loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is a married woman. She has a daughter who is 2 years old. She describes herself to be a principled woman. 

Stellah operates a poultry business where she sells chickens, etc.. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of chicken food. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more chickens. This is her second loan she is requesting from SMEP DTM. Her business goal is to be a supplier of poultry in her town area.

loans.use: to buy more chicks.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 31-year-old married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 2 to 11 years. She describes herself to be a diligent woman. 

Mercy operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 11 year and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located at a cool place near slopes of a mountain and her primary customers are local residents. Mercy is also a farmer where she gets additional income. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy clothes for selling. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will use the anticipated profits in running more wholesale shops.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Ai Sas

texts.en: Ai Sas is 42 years old. She is married and blessed with two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for more than two years and is successful in her career. She runs a rubber plantation. She earns about $20 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Her children are still in her care. In order to improve her family's finances, Ai Sas is requesting a loan of $1,500 to pay for hiring farm workers to cultivate cassava plants. By doing so, she will earn more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to run the rubber plantation and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for hiring farm workers to cultivate her cassava plants.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, 58, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is the mother of children who are now working. She, together with her children, manage their own household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Alicia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages to the neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Alicia earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in net sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php14,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Alicia hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to find time to travel and/or relax in a salon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Kim Song

texts.en: Kim Song is 40 years old. She is widowed and lives with her two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Kim Song has been involved in agriculture for more than two years and is successful in her career. She grows cassava and mushrooms. Kim Song earns about $16 per day. Her children are still in her care. Due to a lack of funds, Kim Song is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase materials to use in mushroom cultivation. By doing so, she will be able to produce more mushrooms to sell and to earn more money. In the future, she would like to expand her business and to help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase materials to use in mushroom cultiavtion

loans.name: Fyuduruva

texts.en: Fyuduruva sells fish for a living. She is 29 years old and married with two young children. She buys fresh fish from fishermen and sells the fish at a profit. She also makes salted and brined fish. Fyuduruva is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to increase her sales and profitability.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Helma

texts.en:
Helma is 41 years old and is a married woman with 7 children, ages between 3 and 24 years. Her husband works as a fisherman and a farmer.

Helma is also involved in fishing. She helps her husband sell his catch at the market. She also grows seaweed to sell. Helma wants to be able to help pay for her children's school fees. She also plans to make improvements to their house. She plans to use her loan to purchase straw, wooden pegs and materials for building a fishing boat. Helma hopes to increase her profits and be able to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase straw, wooden pegs and materials for building a fishing boat

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 34-year-old, hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of building a permanent house and and educating his children to attain better academic qualifications. Godfrey operates a retail shop and the business is very profitable despite challenges of customers not paying on time. However, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming and owning a wholesale shop. Godfrey intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar for sale.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Jojeta

texts.en: Jojeta runs a fishing business with her husband in Bien Unido, Bohol, where they also live. Jojeta has 2 children, ages 7 and 8. She works hard to increase their daily income and provide for their basic needs. She requested a loan to purchase nylon, fishing nets and other materials. Jojeta hopes for this loan to help improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase nylon, fishing nets and other materials

loans.name: Gelva

texts.en: Gelva is a 34 year old man with one child living in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a restaurant and has been in business for a period of 4 years. He started the business with a loan from a financial institution and now his restaurant has developed at a very commendable rate as he now provides outside catering at parties and funerals. He now intends to diversify his business and venture into hiring out tents and chairs for functions since he has already established good relations with a number of customers. Gelva intends to use the loan to buy outdoor tents and chairs for outside catering.

loans.use: to buy tents and chairs for hiring.

loans.name: Jonnabel

texts.en: Jonnabel is 30 years old and married with 2 children, ages 7 and 8. She runs a fishing business with her husband. She sells her husband's catch at their town's market. She also processes dried fish to sell. Jonnabel works hard and only wants the best for her family. She requested a loan to purchase marine plywood, paint and other materials for building a fishing boat. This loan will help bring in more fish for Jonnabel to sell.

loans.use: to purchase marine plywood, paint and other materials for building a fishing boat.

loans.name: Nena's Group

texts.en:
Nena is 68 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no dependent children. 
Nena has a goat raising, buying and selling business and earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional goats to sell. 
Nena has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, Nena hopes to engage in another types of businesses. Nena is the leader of a three-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to be used to purchase additional goats to sell.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is from Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 23 years old. Rolly is single. To make a living, Rolly owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. Rolly has been engaged in his business for 13 years and earns 7,000 PHP a month for this activity.
In 2009, Rolly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Rolly is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer for growing corn. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for growing corn.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en: Rashid is a 30-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a banker, and he has been in banking for eight years. His personal goals are educating his children for the university and building a permanent house for residence. Rashid intends to use the money to cement his house, since his children are always suffering from the flu due to the dust.

loans.use: to cement his house.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a single man. He describes himself to be a visionary and a determined man. He operates a retail store where he sells cereals such as maize, beans, green grams, sorghum, etc. He has been involved in this business for six years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a strategically placed area, and his primary customers are retailers and wholesalers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for a business expansion. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more cereals to sell. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will use the anticipated profits for building a house.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Muvulo

texts.en: Muthui is a 42 year old married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 20 years old. He describes himself to be visionary man. He operates a motorcycle where he provides transportation services. In addition, Muthui farms and runs a hotel.  He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located at a very busy area and his primary customers are retailers businesspersons. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of fuel and poor infrastructure of roads. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs and seeds for the farm. His business goal is to run a transportation industry within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will use the anticipated profits to run a new hardware to increase on his income.

loans.use: to buy farm equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Jilyn

texts.en:
Jilyn is 34 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.
Jilyn has a general store that sells a variety of products, like soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many other things. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more stock for her general store
Jilyn has been a member of PMPC for two months.  Jilyn hopes to own a house and lot someday.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 49 years old and lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a fisherman.

Julita owns and manages a sari-sari store business. She sells items like eggs, soy sauce, vinegar, toiletries and canned goods. Julita is able to help provide for her family's daily needs through her business. She hopes to increase her profits and improve her family's living conditions. She plans to use her loan to buy additional items to sell such as flour, gasoline and canned goods. This will help increase Julita's sales and profitability.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as flour, gasoline and canned goods.

loans.name: Sophanny

texts.en: Sophanny is 29 years old. She is married and resides with her two children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a security guard who earns about $4 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sophanny wants to run an additional business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase dirt to fill up her flooded land so she can grow vegetables. By doing so, she would generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she wants to build a fence around her house and build a bathroom.

loans.use: to purchase dirt to fill up her flooded land for growing vegetables.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a 25-year-old married man. He has a son who is two years old. He describes himself as social and talkative. He operates a welding shop where he sells items such as doors and windows. He has been involved in this business for five years and employs one staff member. His business is located along a commercial town area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy metal. His business goal is to run a hardware store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will use the anticipated profits in paying school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy metal for welding.

loans.name: Leakena

texts.en:
Leakena is 42 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a dish washer for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. One of her children is employed and earns about $2 per day. 

Leakena wants to rebuild her house. With this goal in mind, Leakena is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living condition for her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at her home to earn more income to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house

loans.name: Ingris Joana

texts.es: Con su credikiva, Ingris compró insumos al por mayor como arroz, aceite, granos, carnes, verduras, entre otros, necesarios en la elaboración de la comida que vende en su restaurante “Delicias del Rancho”.  Con ello obtuvo descuentos por volumen, ganando así un poco más de dinero e incrementando el valor de sus inventarios.  Está aplicando a un nuevo crédito con el fin de adquirir un enfriador para almacenar verduras y carnes que le permitan mantener estos ingredientes frescos y conservados, además de seguir comprando al por mayor ya que con esta modalidad le ha ido muy bien.  Su mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Estoy muy agradecida por la ayuda recibida, deseo para ustedes y su familia mucha prosperidad”.
texts.en:
Ingris used her Kiva loan to buy supplies wholesale like rice, cooking oil, grains, meat, and vegetables, among others.  She needs these items to make the food that she sells in her restaurant, “Delicias del Rancho”.  By using the loan she got discounts for volume, which gave her a little extra money and increased the value of her inventory.

She is applying for a new loan to get a cooler to store vegetables and meat.  This will allow her to keep these ingredients fresh and preserved.  Also, she will continue buying wholesale because this has gone very well for her.

Her message to her Kiva lenders is the following, “I am very grateful for the help I have received.  I wish you and your families much prosperity.”

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies and a cooler to store ingredients she uses in the food she sells.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina  is married with ten children. Catalina is 70 years old and lives in Buenavista, Oroquieta City.
Catalina is engaged in buying and selling to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 for additional capital for her buy and sell business.
Catalina has been a member of PMPC for 6 year.  In the future, Catalina hope to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase additional working capital.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 41-year-old married man, who has been working in house painting for the last twelve years. He is a hard worker, who sacrifices his whole life to provide for his family's needs. 

Hassan is well known in the region with his good quality of work and accurate business. To improve his work and to update his type of work with all the new painting techniques, Hassan applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary tools for his business. 

In addition to his painting business, Hassan is employed at the KFC to support his family's income, in case work wasn't stable. 

Hassan will also use part of the loan to support his son's travel to Germany in the coming weeks. 

He hopes that one day his business with develop and improve a lot in a way that he can bring his son back home, and afford his living expenses.

loans.use: To buy tools for his painting business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is from Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Marites is married and has four children. Marites is a farmer. She has been in his business for 10 years and earns 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2007, Marites joined GDMPC. Marites is requesting a loan of 2,700 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Luka

texts.en:
Luka is thirty years old and married with one child. He runs a chemist/pharmacy and he has been in this business for two years earning a monthly income of one hundred and fifty thousand shillings. 

This will be his first loan with KADET and he plans to purchase more stocks of drugs such as original and authentic antibiotics, syrups and other drugs. He plans to use the profit from the business to purchase a plot and build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of drugs such as antibiotics and syrups for the business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is forty-five years old and married with two children. She has owned and managed rental houses for fifteen years now and gets a monthly income of ninety thousand shillings. 

This will be her first loan with KADET and she plans to use it for purchasing building materials such as cement and sand for building more houses. She plans to use the profit from the business to build flats along the highway which will increase her returns and improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase building materials such as cement and for business expansion

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 27-year-old single woman. She has a son who is six months old. She describes herself as a social woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables such as kale, potatoes, onions, cabbages etc. Elizabeth also does farming. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located along a commercial area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the grocery store. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy more vegetables. Her business goal is to venture into a new business of a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will use the profits to educate her child.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is thirty-four years old and married with two children. He runs a herbal products business which has been in operation for ten years earning him a monthly income of seven thousand shillings. 

This will be the first loan with KADET and he plans to use the loan to purchase more stock of herbal products such as toothpastes and toilet soaps. He plans to use the anticipated profits from the business to buy a plot and better the future of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of herbal products such as toothpastes and toilet soap

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
This is Melanie, 35, resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Normelito, and is the mother of three children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to send her children to school. A dream for most poor Filipino parents, like Melanie (she herself was a college undergraduate), is a college education for their children. It is believed that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave their children.

Melanie operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops like Melanie for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to factories. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 540 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 22,000. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Melanie dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own car. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 34-year-old married man and father of two children who has worked as a mechanic for 18 years.
Ahmad started working when he was 16 years old. He had to make his own living because of his parents' difficult financial situation.
In 2000, he opened his own garage and started making his living and improving his name among competitors. His business developed a lot since he started. Ahmad's experience brought his customers' trust and loyalty.
To improve his business, Ahmad applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a scanner necessary for his business.
This scanner will help a lot in improving his business and income.
This is Ahmad's third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. He is in good standing and has a good payment history.
His previous loans helped a lot in improving his business, and he's so proud to be dealing with Al Majmoua.
He hopes to keep on developing his business as much as he can.

loans.use: To buy a necessary scanner for his business.

loans.name: Aslan

texts.en: Aslan is a 30-year-old student at State Managerial Academy. He is studying for his MBA in this university and is in his first year of education. He is working in the State Power Authority. Aslan is married and his wife is also working and studying. He applied for 1000 AZN to pay for his second year of education, because he already paid for the first year. Aslan and his wife are waiting for a baby and their salaries are not enough to cover Aslan`s MBA tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay his second year tuition fee for his MBA.

loans.name: Germana

texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Germana lives in the town of Antequera, Bohol, with her family. She is married and has two children. Her husband works as a driver.

Germana has been in the business of raising hogs for 10 years. She earns 2500 PHP per month. Germana needs additional capital to purchase additional piglets and feed. She hopes to increase her profit and be able to save more.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is married with two children. He runs a retail shop as well as a hardware shop. He has been in these businesses for 14 years and earns a monthly income of 30,000 shillings.

This will be his seventh loan with KADET, and he plans to use it purchase more stock of sugar and flour for the retail shop, as well as cement for the hardware store. He plans to use the anticipated profits from the business to educate his children.

He hopes to have a better family financial status.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of sugar, cement and flour.

loans.name: Luis Javier

texts.es:
En el departamento de Masaya, reside  el Sr. Luis Javier,  casado,  con 45 años de edad,  comerciante este consiste en una pulpería que la tiene desde hace 6 años, a raíz que se le dificulto tener un trabajo como trabajador asalariado, decidió emprender este negocio y el a notado  que le ha dado buenos resultados. Además cuenta que también maneja un pequeño negocio de venta de discos de películas y músicas para DVD, comenzó también con capital propio. Esto lo hace con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos los cuales están en edad escolar. 

Por lo que se presenta a nuestra oficina Ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento que le permita reabastecer con mas productos su negocio y dar un mejor servicio a su comunidad. Y tambien le dará una mejor calidad de vida a su familia en el que tanto se ha esforzado con orgullo.
texts.en:
Luis Javier lives in the Masaya department.  He’s 45 years old, married, and is a merchant.  He has had a general store for six years, which he started because he had trouble finding a salaried position and says that the results have been good.  He also says that he manages a small music and movie DVD business, which he also started with his own capital.  He does these things so that he can get his children ahead.  They are in school.

He comes to our Ceprodel office to request a loan that will allow him to stock up on products for his business so that he can provide better service to his community and also provide his family with a better quality of life, which he struggles for with great pride.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell. She is a 39-year-old married woman with two children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She still has a personal goal to educate her children up to university level.

She sells clothes and has been in business for 11 years, and the business is still profitable. She has a challenge of limited finances to meet the different needs of her customers. Her desire is to own a boutique in the city. Laura needs another loan to buy clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jose Santos Silvano

texts.es:
José, Se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, vive con su esposa y sus seis hijos de 21, 17,15, 14,12, y 10 años de edad, el señor está atendiendo las actividades agropecuarias como lo es sembrando maíz, frijoles, maicillo, esto lo aprendió de sus padres y lo realiza desde hace 30 años, iniciando desde muy temprano todas sus actividades en las que sus hijos le ayudan.
Él solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes agrícolas como el abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, que son necesarios para ayudar a que sus cultivos crezcan más rápido y su cosechas sean abundantes y sanas, ya que les previene las plagas, su riesgo es en la temporada de mucha lluvia lo cual le afecta directamente el cultivo.
El objetivo de José es obtener una buena cosecha que le permita generar ingresos económicos para su familia, trabajando junto con sus hijos y que éstos también puedan prepararse para el futuro.
texts.en:
Jose earns his living farming basic grains. He lives with his wife and his six children of 21, 17, 15, 14, 12 and 10 years old. He carries out agricultural activities such as sowing corn, beans and sorghum. He learnt this from his parents and has been doing this for 30 years. He starts work very early and his children help him. 

He is asking for a loan to buy agricultural fertilizers such as manure, herbicide and pesticide which he needs to help his crops grow more quickly and so that his harvests are healthy and plentiful, since he forsees plagues. There is also a risk that the rainy season may directly affect his crops. 

Jose’s goal is to obtain a good harvest which allows him to make a good income for his family, working together with his children so that they can also prepare themselves for the future.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides and pesticides.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 34 years old and married with two children. He runs a shoe selling business that has been in operation for the last five years, earning a monthly income of 7,000 shillings per month.

This will be his first loan with KADET LTD., and he plans to use it for purchasing more shoes like sandals, leather shoes and others as stock. He plans to use the profits generated to purchase a plot to have a better life in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes like sandals, leather shoes and others.

loans.name: Sok Heng

texts.en:
Sok Heng is 27 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening pigs for more than 10 years, earning approximately $6 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. 

In order to improve her business, Sok Heng is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase pig’s fodder to breed her pigs. This purchase will help her pigs grow faster and earn more profit. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase pig's fodder to breed her pigs.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 28-year-old single man who supports his three siblings. He owns a shop where he stocks soft drinks and snacks, a business he says earns him 13,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month. He has been in this business for the past three years.

He has requested a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase 10 crates of sodas, fresh fruit juices and snacks. The profit he makes will aid him in opening another branch elsewhere, which is also his dream.

loans.use: To purchase 10 crates of sodas, fresh fruit juices and snacks.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a widow who has two children. She is 42 years old and resides at Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Alma owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living.  She's been in this business for seven years.  Each month she earns 14,710 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping.

In 2009, Alma joined GDMPC. In the future, Alma wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping.

loans.name: Munkhtulga

texts.en:
Munkhtulga is a 37-year-old married man who lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He works as a carpenter at local company, while his wife works at a filling station. Munkhtulga is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase necessary construction materials to finish his housing project. In order to complete the construction work, he needs to buy materials for the daubing outer side, and interior structure as well. His family is currently living in a ger, Mongolian yurt. 

Munkhtulga is a responsible and ambitious man who is willing to provide a good quality life for his family. He is very thankful to the lenders who are giving him an opportunity to finish the housing project.

loans.use: to buy essential building materials to complete his housing project.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
This is Marcelina, 44, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother of three children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Marcelina operates a pineapple farm. She grows pineapple and some papayas on her farm. Located in Cavite, the farm is in the highlands, where the land is suited to grow pineapple and papayas. Marcelina sells her product to markets and fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm supplies for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marcelina dreams to be able to give her all her family a good and future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farming supplies and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita is from Caniangan, Tangub City. She is 49 years old. Pacita is married and has two children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, growing crops. Pacita has been in her business for ten years and earns 2,000 PHP a month for this activity. In 2010, Pacita joined GDMPC. Pacita is requesting a loan of 5,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 31 years old and single and has been operating his retail shop for the past six years.He lives in Nakuru town and the business has been very profitable.

This will be his first loan term with KADET LTD, and he plans to use this loan to buy more stock of maize flour, rice as well as fruit for selling at his business. With the anticipated profits, he plans to expand his retail business by buying and selling more goods.

In the future, Ben hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale business to earn more income.

loans.use: to add more stock of rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
This is Nilda, 46, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is single, and currently working hard to sustain her daily needs and to pay for her own electricity.

Nilda operates a market stall. She sells vegetables, raw products and condiments in the community market. She buys bulk quantities of vegetable products and other common items used in cooking and sells per kilo or per piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more vegetable products and condiments to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nilda hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for products and grocery items needed in her business.

loans.name: Bassel

texts.en:
Bassel is a 34-year-old married man and father of three children. He has been working as a mechanic for ten years.  Bassel opened his own garage in 2011, and is planning to expand it to a big car maintenance company in the future.

Bassel applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy car oils and batteries necessary for his business. These requested items will help a lot in improving his income and developing his business.

Bassel will make a lot of effort to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy car oils and batteries necessary for his business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 53-year-old married woman. She has six children whose ages range from 12 to 32 years old. She describes herself to be a social and talkative woman. She operates a general store, where she sells items such as beans, green grams, cooking fat, tea leaves, rice, maize flour, etc. She has been involved in this business for eight years and employs two staff members. Her business is located along a commercial road and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds for improving the business. 

Ruth will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy items such as beans, green grams and cooking fat. Ruth had taken loans from SMEP DTM of Kes 10,000 and Kes 20,000, which she managed to repay. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to use the anticipated profits in educating her children .

loans.use: to buy items such as beans, green grams and cooking fat.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce, 35, is a hard working lady living in Fort Portal Uganda, and has the personal goals of educating her children and building a permanent home. She has a beauty salon, which she has been running for the past five years, and is facing the hardships of customers not paying on time and seasonal weather. However, she has a vision of hiring employees to help grow her business, expanding her business to new markets and moving her business to a more permanent location. She needs a loan to buy more products for her business.

loans.use: to buy more products for her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita runs a fishing business with her husband. She sells her husband's catch at their town's market. She also sells dried fish. Margarita works hard to increase her profits and provide for her family's basic needs. She requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials. She hopes to sustain her children's education and elevate her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a single mother to two children, and lives in Samburu, Kenya where she operates a retail shop. For the past five years, she’s been selling products at retail to support her home. Her greatest strength in her business development is her independent spirit.  This is reflected in the joy she gets from commercial activities that she’s engaged in while selling her products. With the loan she is applying for she wants to add stock by purchasing bags of rice, sugar, bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and other shop-related items.

loans.use: to add stock by purchasing bags of rice, sugar, bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and other shop related items.

loans.name: Marie Josepha

texts.en: Marie Josepha is 39 years old. She sells different items in the boutique, and has been in the business for 10 years. She has three children between four and fifteen years old.  With the loan she will add more rice, cooking oil and soaps to her business to sell. She will use the profits from the business to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité “Maria Auxiliadora” es de la ciudad de Santaní, está integrado por 11 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas que se unieron con el propósito de ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
Mirian es integrante, y comenta que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo está ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo. Ella se dedica al comercio y comenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida, con la cual abastece a sus vecinos.  Comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero que después lo fue reformando con su esfuerzo y lucha.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de productos de primera necesidad, con lo que desea poder surtirse y de esa forma seguir brindando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group “Maria Auxiliadora” is from the city of Santaní. The group is made of 11 women, all friends and neighbors that joined forces with the purpose of helping their families by working together.

Mirian, a member of the group, comments that with a lot of sacrifice and effort she is helping her family through her work. She makes her living in retail and comments that she has a very well stocked convenience store through which she supplies her neighbors with what they need.  She adds that she began with a small business but as time went by she went along improving her business with her effort and persistence.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of convenience products, with which she will be able to further stock her store and in this way continue offering a wide variety of products to her clients.

loans.use: To buy inventory for the convenience store.

loans.name: Felipe Del Socorro

texts.es: Don Felipe  es de la comarca la joya es casado su esposa tuvo 7 hijos de los cuales solo tiene 3 a cargo  y el hijo menor de 16 años estudia el séptimo grado de secundaria.  Felipe se dedica a la siembra de frijol y maíz el inicio a trabajar en la agricultura a los 15 años de edad y a los 22 años se caso fue entonces que  decidió trabajar de manera independiente. Hoy gracias a su enorme esfuerzo y sacrificio durante todos estos años  tiene sus animales y su casa. En la siembra del frijol y maíz además de sus hijos que le ayudan, el paga mano de obra. Felipe dice que cuando sale la cosecha vienen los compradores a la comarca ahí mismo vende la cosecha ya que es más seguro. Felipe necesita este Kiva crédito para comprar los insumos y para pagar parte de la mano de obra para la siembra del frijol y maíz. Esto será de mucho beneficio  Felipe dice que este crédito le será de gran ayuda ya que en estos tiempos  es cuando más necesita el capital de trabajo para empezar de manera pronta las labores de siembra. El dice que una vez que saque la cosecha pagara el crédito y la ganancia que le quede comprar unos animales (vacas).
texts.en: Don Felipe is married and is from the region of La Joya, His wife gave birth to 7 sons, three remain dependent on their parents. The youngest son, 16 years old, is now studying in the 7th grade. Felipe earns his living growing beans and corn. He began working in agriculture at the age of 15. When he was 22 years old he got married; that is when he decided to work independently. Today, thanks to the enormous effort and sacrifice he invested during all of those years, he has his animals and his own home. During the bean and corn harvest, aside from the help his sons provide,  he hires paid laborers. Felipe says that at harvest time the buyers come to the region. He sells his crop to them then, locally, since that is the most secure way. Felipe needs this Kiva loan to buy the consumables he needs and to pay part of the cost of the hired labor for the bean and corn harvest. This will be of great benefit to his business. Felipe says that this loan will be a great help since it is during this time of year when he needs the working capital to promptly begin the harvesting. He says that once he has harvested his crops he will repay the loan and with the earnings he has left, he will buy some cows.

loans.use: to buy the consumables he will need and to pay part of the costs of the hired labor for the harvest of beans and corn.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel se encuentra muy satisfecho después de haber manejado sus anteriores credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, expresa que es un dinero prestado con una tasa de interés que favorece a cualquier microempresario, es por esto que una vez más solicita un crédito para así seguir comprando de contado la harina, grasa, azúcar, huevos, entre otros insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los panes y pudines que vende en su negocio, de esta manera obtiene mayores descuentos por pronto pago, lo que redunda en un mejor margen de ganancia.  También desea seguir invirtiendo en la compra de víveres y abarrotes para surtir la sección de tienda que posee dentro de su negocio.
texts.en: Ángel is pleased after successfully managing his previous Kiva loans with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He states that the loans are issued at interests rates favorable to any micro business; therefore, he is once again requesting a loan to pay cash for flour, oil, sugar, eggs, and other necessary supplies to make the bread and puddings he sells at his business. This way he receives better discounts for prompt payment, which allows him to achieve higher profit margins. He also wishes to buy more groceries and basic supplies to stock the store located within the business.

loans.use: to pay cash for supplies that he uses in his bakery and for resale groceries.

loans.name: Maria Irene

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta y comercialización de mariscos, vive con sus dos hijos, ella realiza el negocio desde hace varios tiempo como un medio para subsistir con su familia y llevar al recurso económico a su hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en producto fresco como el pescado, los camarones, conchas, y otros más que son demandados por los clientes, esta compra ayudará para cubrir y seguir trabajando en el negocio, asimismo ampliará la cantidad de producto que ofrece en el mercado.
Ella quiere en un futuro mejorar el negocio y sus ganancias para qué su condición de vida familiar sea más estable.
texts.en:
María lives with her two children and works selling seafood. She has been working at her business for some time as a way to subsist with her family and bring a financial resource to her home. 

She is asking for a loan to invest it in fresh product such as fish, shrimp, shells, and others that are in demand by her customers. This purchase will help her cover expenses and continue working at her business. At the same time it will expand the quantity of product she offers at market. 

In the future she wants to improve her business and her earnings so her family's living conditions can be more stable.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, and shells.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be social and talkative. She operates a farm where she sells items such as kale, cabbages, tomatoes etc. She has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 2 staff members. Her business is located along a commercial road and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy chemicals to be used in spraying crops. Beatrice had earlier on received two loans from SMEP DTM  of Kes 20,000 and 40,000 which she managed to pay back well. Her business goal is to improve her greenhouse within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children using the profits generated.

loans.use: to buy farm chemicals for spraying the crops.

loans.name: Israel

texts.en: Israel is a 34-year-old hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of building a permanent house for his residence, as he is currently residing in a semi-permanent one. He has been in the transportation sector for the last five years, and he bought his first motorcycle with his personal savings. The hardships he faces include price fluctuations, inflation, and high fuel costs, which reduce his daily savings. He has a vision of buying land to grow crops and buying another motorcycle. Israel needs a loan to buy another motorcycle so as to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Spencer

texts.en: Spencer used the previous loan to purchase maize to sell. He is 39 years old and married with three children who are between 7 and 14 years old. The family is living in their own semi-permanent house in Hoima, Uganda. His goal is to build a permanent house for his family and to educate his children. Spencer is a hard-working man and for the last six years, he has been operating a produce business. He started by farming and then saved to start the business, but he faces a challenge of poor roads and high inflation. He now needs another loan to buy more maize to sell as he has very many orders to deliver maize to schools.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Neri

texts.en: Neri is a 31-year-old farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He has a 4-year-old child. Neri has been tilling his land for 5 years. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Neri works hard to keep his farm productive. He requested this loan to purchase certified seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Neri hopes for this loan to help increase his harvest and profits.

loans.use: to purchase certified seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sare Yoba Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  est créé le 16 Mai 2011 au jour de son inauguration. Composé de  femmes très actives dans les activités génératrices de revenu, elles vivent toutes dans la même localité. Elles pratiquent dans leur majorité le petit commerce et la transformation. 


Madame Ciré,(assise à droite avec la main droite levée),l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe, est . Elle est très active dans les activités du banc villageois et pratique la revente de noix de cajous qu’elle collecte auprès des villageois pour un prix brut de 20 000 FCFA. C’est ainsi qu’elle effectue le tri et la mise en sac de 100 kilogramme pour la revente aux maures à 35 000 FCFA en vu de l’exportation.


Ses bénéfices lui servent à continuer la construction de sa maison en part et la prise en charge de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" was created on May 16, 2011, the day of its inauguration. It is composed of women who are very active in revenue-generating businesses and who all live in the same town. For the most part, they have small business, and they process foods. 

Ms. Ciré (sitting at the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of this group. She is very active in banc villageois activities and is a retailer of cashew nuts, which she collects from villagers for a gross price of 20,000 francs CFA. Then she sorts them and puts them into 100-kg sacks for resale to Moors at 35,000 francs CFA with the aim to export. 

Her profits are partially for continuing with the  construction of her house and for supporting her children.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts in quantity from surrounding villages

loans.name: Pedro Eduardo

texts.es: Pedro Eduardo casado, de 50 años de edad con hijos mayores  tiene su actividad que es la venta de productos lácteos. Tiene más de 8 años en su negocio, Inicio este medio de vida con la necesidad de sufragar ingresos diariamente a su hogar, El crédito que solicita es para la compra de leche, cuajada, crema, leche agria y queso. Siempre busca la forma de mejorar cada día los ingresos de su hogar,  y gracias al apoyo que fundación león 2000  con la ayuda de los financiamientos que ha podido salir adelante.
texts.en: Pedro Eduardo is married, 50 years old, and has adult children. He works selling dairy products. He has had this business for more than 8 years. He began this way of life out of a need to help bring daily income to his home. The loan he is requesting is to buy milk, curds, cream, sour cream, and cheese. He always looks for a way to improve his household income every day, and thanks to the support of the Fundación León 2000, with the help of financing he has been able to come out ahead.

loans.use: to buy milk, curds, cream, sour cream, and cheese.

loans.name: Hector Gustavo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de cuyes,el los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,el socio tambien se sigue dedicando al trabajo de turismo,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es amplair y mejorar el negocio de crianza de cuyes.El socio solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y alimentos para los cuyes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member raises guinea pigs, fattening and then selling them at various festivals. He also works in tourism. He wishes to get ahead, and his dream is to expand and improve his guinea pig business. He is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and feed for them. 

The member is happy to have the loan and promises to make his payment on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Arkipo

texts.en:
Arkipo is a 56-year-old businessman who is married and blessed with four children who are between 28 and 12 years old. He runs an electronics business and a tailoring business in Kabarnet town and these have been his businesses for the last seven years. He gets an average income of KSHS 25,000 a month from both businesses.
  
Arkipo has borrowed his fifth loan of KSHS 60,000 from KADET LTD, after successfully paying his previous loans. With this loan, he intends to use KSHS 45,000 to buy electronic products i.e. switches, bulbs, soldering rods, and wires, among other items while the remaining amount will be used to buy textile materials for his tailoring shop. With the anticipated profits, he intends to expand his business and pay school fees for his children.

His future plan is to be financially stable, expand his business into an electronic wholesale shop and give his children the best education possible.

loans.use: To purchase more electronic products and fabric

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children who are all in school. She takes care of two additional family members (father and mother).

She operates a retail shop that she rents. She operates her business on a retail basis. She gets additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more sugar, rice, flour, soap, cooking oil and crates of soda. Her major business challenges are transportation and the ever-increasing prices of commodities. Her dream is to educate her children up to university and to become wholesaler. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent for her business premises and food.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, maize flour, soap, cooking oil and sodas

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 40-year-old married man who has 3 children between the ages of 2 and 13 years. He looks after one dependent. Two of the children are in school.

Geoffrey started supplying T-shirts to institutions so that he could earn income to meet the growing needs of his household since he was not employed. He works six days a week trying to market his products and doing deliveries. He wants 3,000,000 UGX to increase his capital so that he can meet his client's needs. Apparently he is constrained by limited financial resources. His dream is to grow and expand his business.

He is honest and hardworking. Geoffrey commends Ugafode for being focused on helping the poor. In the photo is Geoffrey at his kiosk with the Ugafode loan officer (L-R) who has consented on the waiver form.

loans.use: To buy materials to supply customers

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa de 33 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por su actividad agricola, ganadera y artesanía. La comunidad en donde reside solo cuenta con servicio de luz.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella ofrece los productos en su domicilio y también los ofrece de casa en casa a sus vecinos desde hace varios años. Usualmente trabaja por pedidos, aunque también cuenta con un pequeño stock de productos fijo en su domicilio que le sirve para satisfacer de mejor modo la demanda de sus clientes, sin tener que esperar a fin de mes, que es cuando llegan sus pedidos.

Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, los cuales cría en su domicilio y los ofrece en venta una vez que se hayan desarrollado completamente. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres con el sostenimiento de su economía familiar.  

Rosa ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para incrementar su stock fijo de productos y para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales. Anteriormente ha tenido un crédito financiado a través de Kiva y le ha ido muy bien, por lo que se encuentra agradecida con las personas que le ayudaron en aquella oportunidad. Ella también agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyarán en esta ocasión.
texts.en:
Rosa, 33, is single and lives with her parents in their house located in a rural area of Tambogrande district in Piura Department.  This area is a known for farming, cattle ranching, and handicrafts. The community only has electricity service.

For several years, Rosa has been selling catalog cosmetics to her neighbors both from her home and door-to-door. Usually, her customers place orders, although she also keeps a small inventory of select products in her home so that she can better meet her customers' needs without waiting until the end of the month when her orders arrive.

She also raises small animals in her house, which she sells once they are fully grown. She uses the income from these activities to pay her personal expenses and help her parents with the family's finances.

Rosa has requested a loan of 2000 nueves soles from Edpyme Alternativa to increase her basic inventory and to buy nutritious feed for her animals. She previously has had Kiva loans that have gone well; she is grateful to the people who supported her then. She also wishes to thank in advance the people who will support this loan request.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to expand her sales business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 40-year-old business lady. She is married to Francis, who is a business man, and they are blessed with two children, ages 19 and 12. She has been in the business of selling livestock for the past six years, with a monthly income of 10,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Veronica will use the loan to purchase more goats and sheep for selling. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. 

She hopes to buy a pick-up for transporting livestock to the nearby market.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and sheep to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 38 years old and is a married woman with three children ages 3, 9, and 14. Her husband works as an electrician.

Marilyn has had a sari-sari store for four years. She earns 5,000 PHP selling toiletries, soy sauce, vinegar, and canned goods to her community. Marilyn works hard to increase her daily sales. She requested this loan to buy rice, soft drinks, canned goods, and other items to sell. Marilyn will be able to pay for her children's school fees with any extra income she earns.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks, canned goods, and other items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy salt, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en: Dativa is 49 years old. She sells sorghum and beans. She has been in the business for the past seven years. She has requested the loan to buy more sorghum and beans to sell. She plans to save the profits.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans to sell.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.en:
Domitila is a 49-year-old businesswoman who is widowed with three children. She has been running a retail shop for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Domitila will use the loan to purchase more stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil for her shop. With the anticipated profits from the business, she will educate her children. 

She hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice and cooking oil for her shop.

loans.name: Edouard

texts.en: Edouard is 49 years old. He is a father of nine children, seven of whom attend school. He owns a bar and has been in that business for 17 years. With the loan, he will buy more beers, mutzig (a type of beer) and sodas to sell. He plans to use the profits to expand his stock of beers to become a distributor in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beers, mutzig and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Agnetta

texts.en:
Agnetta is a farmer who has made progress in her goal thanks to her capacity to work and her love for her family, which consists of her three children. She does farming and sells fresh vegetables. She also is the owner of a cereals shop business, through which she generates income for the family. She began this business five years ago. 

Little by little, Agnetta has been able to expand what she offers, selling cereals of maize and beans and other distinctive products and now she has a domestic market made up of her neighbors. Her dream is to grow and expand her market, but her working capital is often insufficient in order to meet her goal of prosperity. This is the reason she is asking for a Kiva loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will use the loan to purchase cereals such as bags of maize, beans, rice and peas with which she will be able to get substantial discounts by buying in volume and this is the groundwork for the success of her Kiva loan that has her enthusiastic and dreaming.

loans.use: to purchase cereals such maize, beans, rice and peas

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en: Emerthe is 30 years old. She is a widow and has two children aged between 4 and 8. The oldest attends school. She has been selling rice, bananas, and peanuts for seven years. The loan will be used to buy more rice and bananas in bulk to sell. She plans to save the profits from the business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, bananas and peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with four children and all of them attend school. She is looking after her sister.

She has been selling charcoal in the market for the last four years at retail, working seven days a week. She also sells piped water to the neighbors and old clothes at her home.

She has requested a loan of UGX 2,500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more charcoal and secondhand clothes for resale. Her business challenges include transporting the charcoal from upcountry to the market and even seasonality. Her dream is to make sure that the profits she makes can cater for her old age, to own a delivery van for ease in transportation and enable her to build rental houses when saved. She joined MCDT because of the timely loans and the good customer care exhibited by the staff. She lives in a family house with no access to electricity but with piped water. Her major monthly expense is school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and secondhand clothes for resale

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is 52 years old. He sells sorghum and has spent 14 years in the business. The loan he has requested will be used to buy more sorghum. The profits from the business will be for buying a vehicle to facilitate the business.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 64-year-old married man and father of two children who has been working in the car body repair business for 30 years. In 1995, Mohamad started his own business to improve his living. His has expanded over the years but needs a small amount of external cash to support the business from time to time. That's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. He will use the loan to buy necessary tools and products requested. Mohamad is a hard worker and a beloved father. He will also use part of the loan to help his daughter to pay for her baby's delivery soon.

Mohamad hopes to keep on supporting his children as much as he can because they mean the world to him.

loans.use: To buy tools and products for his business and pay for medical expenses

loans.name: Bintimasud

texts.en:
Bintimasud, 32, lives in Msambweni, Kenya and has a family business preparing fried food and fast food. Her business was born five years ago after she divorced her husband and became an independent woman. 

Now she is applying for her first Kiva loan, because she needs to grow the business and to do that she needs to find suppliers from whom she can buy in volume and on a cash basis, as they offer a better price. This is the reason for this Kiva loan, the fifth loan that she has taken from Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will use this loan to buy raw materials such as cooking oil and cereals. Her investment will be successful because she will get discounts that will increase her profits right away, and also will benefit her customers. Her goal for the future is to have her own place where she can operate a big restaurant, offering a variety of dishes that are specialties of the region.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as cooking oil and cereals.

loans.name: Somaya

texts.en:
Somaya is a 57-year-old widow who has been working for the past 11 years to raise her only child and make their living. Somaya is Palestinian, living in Ain Al Helwi Camp, the home of many Palestinians living in Lebanon.

Somaya sells perfumes, shampoo and cosmetics to neighbors, relatives and friends. Her business is going just fine but she dreams of expanding it soon through opening a big shop. To increase her income, Somaya applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business capital with newly released cosmetics, perfumes and shampoos, suitable for the summer season.

This is Somaya's tenth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with an excellent history of repaying loans. All of her previous loans helped a lot in improving her family's living, she said.

loans.use: To increase her business capital with newly released products, such as cosmetics, perfumes and  shampoo

loans.name: Dina Lilian

texts.es:
Dina, vive con su esposo y nietos, ella administra una tienda, también vende leña y practica las labores agrícolas, desde hace 27 años se encuentra trabajando en las diferentes actividades que aprendió de sus padres, esto le ha permitido poderle ofrecer a su familia todo lo necesario.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de leña en gran cantidad, también boquitas, granos básicos y otros que son necesarios para la variedad en el negocio, este préstamo será una gran ayuda pues podrá estabilizarse.
La aspiración de ella es mejorar el local de la venta y poder agregar nuevos productos para que sus clientes aumenten la demanda y así generar más ingresos en la familia.
texts.en:
Dina lives with her husband and grandchildren.  She runs a store.  She also sells firewood and participates in agricultural labor.  For the past 27 years she has worked in different activities that she learned from her parents.  This has allowed her to offer her family all of the necessities.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase a large quantity of firewood, as well as snacks and basic grains and other things that are necessary to supply variety for her business.  This loan will be of great help since it will allow her to stabilize things.  

Dina's aspiration is to improve her shop and to be able to add new products so that her customers will have increased demand and thus she will generate more income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase firewood, snacks and basic grains.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is a 49-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her livelihood is food-vending. She earns 3000 PHP per month selling home-cooked meals to her community. Norma would like to increase her sales and be able to provide for her family's basic needs. She requested this loan to purchase meat, vegetables, spices and other ingredients. Norma hopes to be a professional cook in the future.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, spices and other ingredients

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras, pescado, es una persona de hogar, vive con su esposo y tiene una hija a la cual apoya económicamente, María aprendió el negocio por unas amistades, ya que ella solamente realizaba la agricultura y desde hace algún tiempo también está dedicada al comercio.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos frescos como manzanas, peras, bananos, sandía, también papas, repollo, cebollas, y de ser posible una parte en mariscos. Este préstamo ayudará a mejorar el inventario del negocio ofreciendo mayor variedad con la esperanza de generar mejores ganancias para su hogar.
La aspiración de María es tener un negocio mucho más amplio y mejorar las ventas con la clientela ya que esto le dará una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Maria sells fruit, vegetables, and fish. She is a housewife who lives with her husband and has a daughter that she helps economically. Maria learned the business from friends; she had previously only dedicated her efforts to agriculture. Now, for some time, she has been involved in commerce.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy fresh products such as apples, pears, bananas, watermelons, and also potatoes, cabbage, and onions, and, if possible, some shell fish. This loan will help improve her business inventory and offer a greater variety, in hopes of generating better earnings for her home.

Maria's aspiration is to have a much more ample business and better sales with her present clientèle, and thus provide greater economic stability for her family.

loans.use: buy apples, pears, bananas, watermelons, potatoes, cabbage, and onions to sell.

loans.name: José Abraham

texts.es:
José Abraham, casado, con 49 años de edad, de oficio zapatero,  su núcleo familiar es de cuatro sus hijos y su esposa, con  7 años de tener su propio negocio el cual emprendió con mucho esfuerzo con capital propio, pero con forme va pasando el tiempo ve que su clientela a aumentado por lo que necesita invertirle mas acpitak de trabajo comprando  los diferentes materiales como   pega blanca, pega amarilla, forro fino, forro de galleta, azulón, suela champiom, royal, cajuela, cambrillones, Brasil. Y poder sastifacer la demanda, cuenta con tres trabajadores y el que también apoya para sacar  rápido el producto como es el calzado para damas en el que se especializa más.

Nuevamente se acerca a nuestra oficina para solicitar un nuevo préstamo, que le permita realizar la compra que esta requiieriendo porque esta teniendo varios pedidos y no quiere desaprovechar la oportunidad de venta. Comenta que esta ayuda que adquiere por parte de Ceprodel le ha dado buenos beneficios, tanto económicos como familiar, por lo que le esta muy agradecido.
texts.en:
José Abraham, married and 49 years old, is a cobbler. His immediate family is a family of four, made up of his 4 sons and his wife. He has had his own business for 7 years. He launched his business with a lot of effort and his own capital. With the passage of time he has seen his client base grow. As a result he needs to invest more working capital, buying the various raw materials he uses, such as white glue, yellow glue, fine shoe lining, foam lining, shoe soles, shoe shanks, and other parts and raw materials for shoemaking.  In order to satisfy his clients´ demand, he has three workers who support him in order to rapidly produce his products, such as women’s shoes, which are his specialty. 

José has returned to the office of Kiva´s partner Ceprodel to request a new loan, a loan that will allow him to purchase the raw materials he needs. He has received various orders and does not want to miss the opportunity to make the sales. He comments that the help he receives through Kiva’s partner has brought him good benefits, economically and with his family. For all of this, he is very grateful.

loans.use: To buy glues, fine lining, foam lining, shoe soles, shanks and other materials with which to make shoes.

loans.name: Carlos Francisco

texts.es:
Carlos, está solicitando un préstamo, porque está iniciando su labor agrícola de la temporada, el quiere comprarse los materiales como el abono, herbicidas, para seguir en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, espera seguir trabajando las tierras y hacerlas cada vez más productivas.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ya que logro comprarse los insumos agrícolas, para el cultivo anterior, dándole una buena cosecha, de esta misma manera espera tener buenos resultados con esta nueva siembra.
texts.en:
Carlos is requesting a loan because he is about to start the new cycle of farming activity and he wants to buy supplies such as manure and weed-killers to continue growing corn and beans. He hopes to continue working in his lands and to make them even more productive.
The previous loan has had a positive effect on his activity, as he has succeeded in buying farming supplies to use for his previous crop cycle, thus getting a good harvest, and he hopes to obtain the same good results with his new crop.

loans.use: To buy manure and weed-killers.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 40 years old. He has four children and his wife works as a farmer. He has spent seven years in the business of selling beans and sorghum in the market. He has requested a loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. With the profits, Emmanuel will be able to expand the volume of the store and thus make more sales. In the future, he would like to own a foodstuff depot.

loans.use: to buy beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and raw materials to make hand-crafted vases and flowers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,la socia vende chompas,polos,guantes y mantas,la socia distribuye a diferentes tiendas donde se vende la artesania,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar chompas,mantas,guantes y polos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The entrepreneur continues earning her living selling handmade crafts. She sells sweaters, polo style shirts, gloves and blankets, distributing these products to various stores that sell handicrafts. She works from 8:00 AM until 6:00 PM. Through this business she has raised her son. He dream is to expand and improve her craft selling business. She is requesting the loan in order to buy sweaters, blankets, gloves and polo style shirts in large quantities. 

The loan makes this entrepreneur happy and she commits to promptly making her repayments.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, blankets, gloves and polo style shirts in wholesale quantities.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 39-year-old businesswoman and a single mother of three children. She has been selling cereals for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family. Sarah is applying for her first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Sarah will use the loan to buy dry maize and beans for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Sarah's business goal is to build a store for storing her grains near the market.

loans.use: to buy dry maize and beans for her cereal business.

loans.name: Damalie

texts.en:
Damalie lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, both of whom are going to school; she does not support any additional family members. She lives in her husband’s house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are utility bills, feeding the family, and school fees.

Seven days a week, Damalie sells second hand clothes in a roadside retail kiosk, a business she has had for the last four years. She also keeps poultry and sells the matured birds wholesale. Her business challenges include the high prices of both used clothes and chicken feed, as well as the seasonality of the market. 

Damalie joined MCDT because she did not have to walk long distances to access their services. She has requested a loan of UGX 900,000 from MCDT- SACCO to purchase more clothes for sale and to purchase bulk chicken feed. Damalie's dream is to accumulate enough profits to construct a new and bigger chicken house, and also to start importing used clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale and bulk chicken feed.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a 30-year-old businessman who is married to Alice, a businesswoman. They are blessed with one child. He has been selling new clothes for the past eight years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family. Martin is applying for his second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to expand his stock of new cloths for his shop. With the anticipated profits from the business, Martin will open another clothes shop and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy new cloths for his shop.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
