She says that her business has become successful thanks to the help of her husband and children, and to the help of the loans she has received from Ceprodel. Aside from this business, she also has two moto taxis which she has obtained thanks to her hard work.
She has come to our office in order to request a new loan. She feels that this loan will help her to increase her sales and improve her quality of life, providing her family with better comfort in their home.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar, firewood, and construction materials, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: La Sra. Doris  tiene 41 años  y es soltera con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 13 y 18 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de panes y variedad de horneados ella vende en su tienda que se encuentra ubicado en la zona el Retoño,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Doris utilizara este  préstamo  para la compra de un horno industrial  para mejorar su negocio ya que incrementa sus ventas y el horno que tenia no le permite hacer en cantidad, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la necesidad de satisfacer  los pedidos de su clientela, la Sra. Doris  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de utensilios va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir mejorando en su negocio, y así de esta manera generar más ingresos y por ende  mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia, con el tiempo desea tener una panadería mucho mas equipada, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Doris is 41 years old and is single with two children who are 13 and 18 years old.  She works making and selling breads and a variety of baked items.  She sells bread in her store which is located in the Retoño zone.  This loan is her third sequence with Kiva's partner institution.  Doris will use this loan to purchase an industrial oven in order to improve her business since her sales are growing and the oven that she had would not permit her to bake in quantity.  Her reason for requesting this loan is the need to satisfy the requests of her customers.  Doris faces challenges in her business, including the lack of utensils.  She plans to utilize the income to continue improving her business, and in that way generate more income with the goal of improving the quality of life for her family.  With time she desires to have a much more well-equipped bakery.  She feels happy and grateful to Kiva and its partner for the support given.

loans.use: To purchase an oven

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo, age 50, is a retailer. She sells household consumption goods like wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat, coconuts, etc. Ever since she started, she has considered it a good business opportunity. She started offering sale from home to her neighbours. Her dream is to have a wholesale shop to earn more profits and help her support her family's well-being.

Her goal is to improve her retail shop business and to respond to the demands of the market, but her working capital stands as a large impediment to achieving her goals. Currently, she is applying for a micro-loan, with which she will expand and diversify her business and establish a transport business, i.e., purchase a motorcycle for transport business. From there, she will really begin her road to achieving her greatest goal of becoming a wholesale supplier.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and all her children go to school. She takes care of other additional family members. She sells second-hand clothes. She operates her business on a retail basis and sells her products door–to-door. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last one year.

Susan has requested a loan of 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to educate her children up to university and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es: El Sr.  Adrian es divorciado y con tres hijos, trabaja como encargado de una lavandería desde hace ya ocho años laborando, persona seria y responsable, también arregla lavadoras y secadoras para aumentar el ingreso familiar. Necesita apoyo para pagar la escuela de sus hijos pues son tres y quiere que sigan estudiando. La falta de la madre a sido muy difícil para sus hijos y mas para el porque quedo con la carga de educar y mantener a sus hijos, él solo quiere asegurar la educación de sus hijos para brindarles un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Adrian is divorced and has three children.  He has worked as a manager of a laundromat for eight years and is a serious and responsible person.  He also fixes washing machines and dryers to increase the family income.  He needs support to pay for his children's schooling, since there are three of them and he wants them to continue studying.  The lack of their mother has been very difficult for his children and also for him because he became in charge of educating and maintaining his children.  He only wants to assure the education of his children in order to offer them a better future.

loans.use: PAGO DE REINSCRIPCION  Y CUOTAS ESCOLARES

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, ya que tiene el objetivo de realizar la elaboración de redes de pesca para esto necesita este financiamiento comprándose hilo, cáñamo, y Marcos, que son necesarios para poder elaborar las redes.
El manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le abrió las posibilidades para mejorar su actividad, esto le ha atraído más clientes y por lo mismo ha tenido mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jose, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, ya que tiene el objetivo de realizar la elaboración de redes de pesca para esto necesita este financiamiento comprándose hilo, cáñamo, y Marcos, que son necesarios para poder elaborar las redes.
El manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le abrió las posibilidades para mejorar su actividad, esto le ha atraído más clientes y por lo mismo ha tenido mejores ganancias.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all of them attend school. She does not look after any other dependents.  She has been selling tomatoes and other vegetables and raw foods at retail for the past seven years, working seven days a week. She has no other sources of income.

Cissy has requested for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to purchase more raw food. Her challenges include keeping them fresh, especially in the dry season, and reduced profits when other harvests are also abundant. Her dream is to accumulate enough profit to buy a piece of land and build her own house and also to buy a freezer. She joined MCDT because of their interest in serving the poor. She rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes and other vegetables and raw foods.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and both of them attend school. She is looking after her mother.

Halima has been operating a beauty salon away from home for the last four years, working seven days a week. She does not operate any other businesses.  

Halima has requested a loan of UGX 900,000 from MCDT-SACCO to enable her buy hair extensions and weaves for resale. Her business challenges include seasonality in the market and unstable power supplies. Halima's dream is to have a big salon in the city center where there is higher demand for her services. She joined MCDT because of the low interest rates. She rents a house with access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To buy more hair extensions and weaves for resale.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma used his previous Kiva loan to buy bundles of maize flour, sugar and washing detergents. He sold very well and he did very well, too. Since receiving his Kiva loan, liquidity has improved, allowing him to buy larger amounts of materials for cash which qualified him for many discounts.

He is currently renovating to a permanent house which makes him very happy because this will provide stability for his family. His goal is to attain a larger expansion of his market to reach higher sales than currently.

With the new Kiva loan he’s applying for, he will buy raw materials and baking supplies like wheat flour, sugar and fats, among others. His message for Kiva lenders is the following: “Continue helping small businesses and increase loan amounts.”

loans.use: to buy raw materials and baking supplies like wheat flour, sugar and fats, among others.

loans.name: Seray

texts.en:
This is 44 year-old Seray.  She is married, and has 5 children aged 17, 16, 10, 8, and 6 years of age. She has no additional dependents living with her.   In 2010, Seray established her cosmetics business. She began her business to earn a living.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Seray requires a loan to buy 10 cartons of assorted cosmetics @Le 3,500,000, with Le 500,000 for transportation. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 429,000.  Seray is excited for the loan and she is planning to expand her business.  She also hopes to see her only daughter educated to university level.  Honest and hardworking, Seray thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 10 cartons of assorted cosmetics

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has two children, both of whom attend school. She sells food products, green vegetables, tomatoes, citrus fruits, and products as retail and to small-business customers and her neighbors. 

Rose began her life as a merchant three years ago with the goal of working on her own and contributing to the support of her household. With very little education, she thought that gradually it would become an option for self-employment that would allow her to get ahead and achieve growth for herself and her family. Her long-term goal is to educate her children so they become successful and happy people.

Currently, she plans to grow her business gradually. This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first from Yehu Microfinance Trust. With this loan, she plans to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar for her retail shop. Her investment will be successful because it is based on market demand and on her vast business experience.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar

loans.name: Meshomari

texts.en:
Meshomari is married and has seven children. She lives in Msambweni with her husband and children. She has a fruit and vegetable business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. 

This is the third loan that Meshomari has requested from Yehu Microfinance Trust because she needs to buy a greater amount of fruit and vegetables. At the moment, she does not have enough working capital to increase her sales because she buys on a daily basis and in small quantities. Her goal is to have a grocery store in her own house, where she will be helped by her husband, and which would give her a higher income so that she can keep improving her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a greater amount of fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Isata.  She is married, and has one child who is 16 years old. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she is her late sister’s child. 

In 2002, Isata established her hair products, jeans, shirts, shoes, and salon business. She began her business to be self-reliant. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, Isata earns about 1,100,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Isata has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional hair products, shirts, jeans, and blouses. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 400,000 SLL. In the future, Isata plans to improve her business and move to the center of town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for hair products, jeans, and blouses.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah used her previous Kiva loan to pay school fees for her children who attend school. Her business of motorcycle transportation has done very well. She is currently diversifying to a water selling business to earn more profits in her business. Her goal is to attain a larger expansion of her market to reach higher sales than currently.

With the new Kiva loan she’s applying for, she will buy a water tank to store water for sale. Her message for Kiva lenders is the following: “Continue helping small businesses and improve their income.”

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store water for sale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children of whom two attend school. She is looking after a grandson.
She has been selling dried fish for the last six years at both wholesale and retail in the market, working six days a week. She earns additional income from tailoring. She lives in the family house with access to electricity and no piped water. Her major monthly expense is school fees and medical bills.
She has requested for a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more dried fish for sale. Her business challenges include high, unstable prices and seasonality. Her dream is to see her business become more of a wholesale point than a retail one. She joined MCDT because of the timely loans.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of 6 children living together in the Mwambalazi, Kenya. She has a stall at the market where she sells dry fish. Her main customers are her neighbors, relatives and friends.

Since her clientele has increased, Mwaka has quite a challenge, which is to have enough fish in stock available to please them. Her growing clientele leads to her working capital being insufficient to do so. This is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan to buy bundles of fish for sale at wholesale so that she can gradually become a supplier of fish to restaurant operators.

loans.use: to buy bundles of fish for sale

loans.name: Ytamar

texts.es:
Ytamar tiene 65 años de edad, tiene su casa propia donde vive con su esposo, su hijo y su nuera desde hace 25 años. No cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, solo cuenta con servicio de luz, su vivienda se encuentra ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Zaña que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo. En la zona se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de ganado caprino (cabras y chivos), desde hace algunos años, el lugar donde cría  sus animales en la parte posterior de la casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y pastos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela en la ciudad de Chiclayo.  Adionalmente tiene una bodega que ha instalado en uno de los ambientes de su vivienda. La idea de este negocio surgió de la demanda que existe en la zona por productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades le permiten obtener mayores ganacias para cubrir sus necesidades diarias.  

Ytamar solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad que le permitan ampliar su bodega, así como alimento para sus animales, con estas acciones ella espera mejorar su calidad de vida y satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta.

Anteriormente ha tenido un crédito financiado a través de Kiva y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Le fue muy bien, por lo que agradece a las personas que le apoyaron en aquel momento. Ytamar  agradece de antemano a las personas que colaboren con ella en esta ocasión.
texts.en:
Ytamar is 65 years old.  For the past 25 years, she has had her own home where she now lives with her husband, son and daughter-in-law.  She doesn't have all of the basic services; she only has electricity.  Her home is found located in the rural zone of the Zaña district which belongs to the Chiclayo province.  In this area, people work principally in agriculture and raising animals.   

She has worked raising and selling goats for several years.  The place where she raises her animals is in the area behind her home.  She feeds them with balanced meals and natural grasses.  When they reach the ideal size and weight, she offers them in the various markets, since she has her own customers in the city of Chiclayo.  In addition, she has a small store that she has set up in one of the rooms of her home.  The idea of this business arose out of the demand that existed in the area for staple goods and groceries.  The income that she expects from these activities will allow her to obtain greater income to cover her daily needs.

Ytamar requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase groceries and staple goods to expand her store, as well as feed for her animals.  In taking this action, she hopes to improve her quality of life and satisfy the demand of her customers.

Previously, she has had a loan through Kiva and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in her payments.  It went very well for her, for which she thanks all the people who supported her in that moment.  Ytamar 

Anteriormente ha tenido un crédito financiado a través de Kiva y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Le fue muy bien, por lo que agradece a las personas que le apoyaron en aquel momento. Ytamar extends gratitude in advance to all those who will collaborate with her on this occasion.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and staple goods to expand her store.

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.en: Jacqueline is 44 years old. She is married and has three children, and all are old enough to go to school. Jacqueline is a group leader of "Tuzamurane" which means "Raise Together" in English. All the group members have different businesses. Jacqueline sells rice, sugar, and salt. She has spent four years in the business. With the loan from the business she will buy another ton of rice, and sugar to sell. With the profits from the business will pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children, and two are in school. She does not take care of other additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense includes school fees, rent, and food.
She operates a retail shop that she rents. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last 3 years.

She has requested for a loan of 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy sugar, rice, flour, soap, and cooking oil. Her major business challenges are transportation and increasing prices of commodities. Her dream is to educate her children up to university and also to own a fully stocked shop.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, flour, soap and cooking  oil

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah is 36 and lives in Mwambalazi, Kenya, where she has a chicken distribution business. She started the business two years ago. Her first step was to study the market, and make pre-sales visits to restaurants in order to start her business venture. She has managed to secure a market for her chickens, as her strategic location is her greatest strength.

Dorah is very enthusiastic about the growth of her business. She works every day, doing her best to increase her clientele, and she has managed to do so. Her greatest challenge is that her working capital is insufficient to meet her projected market demand.

This is precisely the need she would resolve with her Kiva loan, her first with the Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will use it to buy poultry chicks and chicken feed, to supplement her business, and to have a greater range of products to meet her customers' greatest needs.

Her dream is to succeed in expanding her business, and keep it stocked at all times with a variety of chicken products. While this is happening, she works tirelessly, managing a rapid turnover of accounts receivable and of her stock, which she is managing to invest in, though not in the quantities she aims to.

loans.use: to buy poultry chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Sikajje

texts.en: Sikajje is a 44 year old divorcee with four children. Two of her children attend school. She started tailoring in 1998 so that she could sustain her family's needs as a single mother. Out of hard work, she has managed to get contracts to make sport uniforms and sweaters for some schools. This has helped her educate her children. She would like a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy materials for sewing the uniforms. Her challenge is that she lacks enough capital to buy all of the materials. She is also challenged by the lack of a good sewing machine to make the work faster; the local machines are time consuming and of poor quality. She is also unable to meet her customer's needs at the moment. Her dream is to buy foreign machines to make her work better and faster. Sikajje is very hard working and shrewd.

loans.use: to buy materials for making sweaters.

loans.name: Ernelia

texts.en: Ernelia is 62 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and has four children. Ernelia owns a general store that sells dry goods and groceries. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of PHP30,000 to purchase more stock for her general store. Ernelia has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Ernelia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en: Paulita is 61 years old and lives in San Isidro, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. Paulita has a hog-fattening business and earns approximately PHP3,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP5,000 to purchase feed and vitamins. Paulita has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, Paulita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is 44 years old and lives in San Juan, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. Thelma has a vegetable vending business and earns approximately PHP1,500 per month. She has requested a loan of PHP3,000 to purchase additional vegetables to sell. Thelma has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Thelma hopes to engage in other business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 54 years old and lives in Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  She is married and has one child.  

Esterlita has a dressmaking business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to be used for purchasing clothes and other sewing accessories for her business.  

Esterlita has been a member of PMPC for almost six years.  In the future, Esterlita hopes to establish her own boutique and dress shop.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and other sewing accessories

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is single with one child.  She is 51 years old and lives in Tinacla-an, Clarin.  

Milagros is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living.  She has been doing this for five years.  Milagros has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase additional feed and vitamins.  

Milagros has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, Milagros hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 60 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez.  Rosenda is married and has two children.  

Rosenda has a store that sells a variety of products.  Rosenda has had this business for four years.  Rosenda requested a loan of 14,900 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. 

Rosenda has been a member of PMPC for four years.  In the future, Rosenda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 62 years old and lives in Lupagan, Clarin.  Leonor is single with no children.  

Leonor has a store that sells variety of products.  Leonor has had this business for 15 years.  Leonor requested a loan of 14,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase additional items: ready-to-wear clothing.

Leonor has been a member of PMPC for seven years.  In the future, Leonor hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items (ready-to-wear clothing)

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen is 33 years old and lives in Goaw, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with four children.

To earn a living, Arlen has a business of selling a variety of foods. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Arlen has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

Arlen has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Arlen would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Candido

texts.en:
Candido is married with three children. Candido is 52 years old and lives in Compra, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Candido sells charcoal to earn a living and has had this business for eight years. Each month, he earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to add to his stock of charcoal for his retail business.

Candido has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Candido hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To add to his stock of charcoal for his retail business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 35 years old and lives in Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 3 children.

To earn a living, Maribel has a business selling a variety of foods. She earns about 1000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Maribel has requested a loan of 3000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Maribel has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Maribel would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Jean Carlos

texts.es: Jean Carlos es un joven de 21 años residente en el barrio La Inmaculada de Soledad.  A su corta edad se dedica a varias actividades, una de ellas, que es por la que solicita su primer credikiva, es la venta de ropa exterior para damas y caballeros, calzado, maquillaje y detalles en general tanto de contado como a crédito entre familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector. Con el crédito desea obtener capital de trabajo para comprar un mayor volumen de mercancía para la venta, ya que uno de sus desafíos ha sido no poder atender algunos pedidos que le hacen sus clientes por falta del mismo. Vende tanto de contado como a crédito entre familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector.  No teme de realizar la inversión ya que al satisfacer la demanda actual y diversificar sus productos alcanzaría una mayor rentabilidad, hecho que le genera  mucha confianza.   Inició en el comercio hace 3 años, como una fuente de ingresos mientras estudiaba Mecánica de Computación en una entidad de formación oficial.  Gracias a esto, hoy puede ofrecer sus servicios en una empresa privada como mecánico, de lo cual también se beneficia económicamente.  Cuando no está en el negocio cuenta con la colaboración de su familia, especialmente de su hermana, con las ventas y atención al público.  Para el desarrollo de la actividad cuenta con algunos enseres  como lo son: vitrinas, maniquíes y exhibidores, sin embargo, dentro de sus sueños está ampliar su miscelánea y convertirla en un gran almacén que pueda generar empleo y mayores ganancias que le permitan seguir estudiando para ser un profesional.  Se considera un joven muy activo y con muchas ganas de  adelante.
texts.en: Jean Carlos is a 21 years old young man who lives in La Inmaculada de Soledad neighborhood. At his young age he does several activities for a living. One of them, the one he is requesting a Kiva loan for, is the sale of clothes for ladies and gentlemen, footwear, make up and accessories in general, both in cash and on credit, among family members, friends and neighbors of the area. With the loan he hopes to get working capital that will allow him to buy a higher volume of merchandise for sale, since one of his challenges has been not being able to get some of the orders made by his customers due to the lack of it. He sells both in cash and on credit among family members, friends and neighbors of the area. He is not afraid to make this investment, since by satisfying current demand and diversifying his products, he would get a higher profitability, fact that gives him a lot of confidence. He began working in the commerce business 3 years ago, to have a source of income while he was studying Computer Mechanics at an official educational institution. Thanks to this, nowadays he is able to offer his services at a private company as a mechanic, which is also an income source for him. When he is not at the store his family helps him, especially his sister, with the sales and with helping the customers. For the development of his business he uses some equipment such as: display cabinets, mannequins, showcases. Still, one of his dreams is to expand his store and turn it into a big department store that can generate employment and bigger profits that will allow him to continue studying and become a professional. He considers himself to be a very active young man and very willing to progress.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as clothes, footwear, make up and other miscellaneous items to support his customers' demands

loans.name: Soperiana

texts.en:
Soperiana is married with one child. Soperiana is 43 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Soperiana is a farmer and grows different vegetables in her garden to earn a living. She has been doing this for 22 years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase medicines/fertilizers for her garden.

Soperiana has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Soperiana hopes to expand her garden to plant other vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase medicines/fertilizers for her garden

location.town: Liloy-Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Joven

texts.en:
Joven is single. Joven is 29 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Joven sells plastic wares to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, he earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more plastic wares to sell.

Joven has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Joven hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic wares to sell

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is age 27 and married with two children, ages 8 and 6 years old. He has been in various businesses – mainly running a phone charging and barber shop in his rural home besides farming. He has now had two years in active farming and currently produces milk, tea and eggs for the local market.

Eric has made a loan request for 62,400 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to buy an additional dairy cow in order to expand his milk production capacity. He says the income will be channeled to improve his family's living standards. Eric notes that access to capital has always been a challenge and Juhudi Kilimo loans will alleviate the challenge.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: El Señor Es Mi Rey Group

texts.es: El banco comunal el Sr es mi rey esta conformado por 12 integrantes, Damaris, Maryuris, Merali, Aura, Maria Jesús, Heydi, Melba, Milena,Vilma, Roger, Candelaria. Todas tienen actividades económicas diferentes, todas se apoyan mutuamente, Melba es la coordinadora del grupo  ella tiene por actividad económica la venta y crianza de cerdos en la localidad de su comunidad. El financiamiento es para comprar y vender cerdos para la sasficaccion de su clientela.
texts.en: El Señor es mi Rey communal bank is made up of 12 members, Damaris, Maryuris, Merali, Aura, Maria Jesús, Heydi, Melba, Milena, Vilma, Roger, Candelaria. They all do different economic activities and they all support each other. Melba is the coordinator of the group; she sells and raises pigs in her community's locality. The loan is to buy and sell pigs to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy, sell and market pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is married with six children. Analiza is 42 years old and lives in Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Analiza owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for six months. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase more inventory for her general store.

Analiza has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Analiza hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her general store

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a farmer in her rural hometown of Kisii. She is married with two children, ages 13 and five. She has been farming for 20 years and runs the farm with the help of one farmhand. She produces mainly maize, beans, vegetables and milk for the local market. She runs a retail shop selling farm produce like cereals and vegetables which she sources from her farm as well as from other local farmers. Hellen has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will boost her milk output for her family's consumption and income through sale. She plans to establish a milk parlor business in the local market once her milk production stabilizes. Hellen says sourcing capital is always a challenge to farmers and Juhudi Kilimo loans will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул  - участник группы «Ынтымак 22», ей 32 года. Айнагул занимается производствеом национальных рукотворных ковров ("шырдак") из войлока. Создав свою группу и наладив производство посредством совместного закупа материалов и надомного исполнения заказов, группа имеет доход от продажи своей продукции около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнагул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS) на закуп необходимого сырья. Доходы от кредита Айнагул совместно с группой планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса посредством покупки машинки для пошива национальных головных уборов колпак.
texts.en: Ainagul is 32 years old and is a member of the Intimak 22 group. Ainagul hand sews traditional Kyrgyz rugs ("shirdaks") from wool felt. After forming itself into a group, organizing its production around the joint purchase of materials and having members work on orders at their homes, the group earns about 20,000 somi (KGS) each month from the sale of its products.To grow her business, Ainagul has asked Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 10,000 somi (KGS) to purchase materials needed for manufacturing rugs. Ainagul, together with the group, plans on investing the proceeds from the loan into growing the business by purchasing machines for sewing traditional Kyrgyz headdresses.

loans.use: to purchase materials for carpet manufacturing

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio y algunas reparaciones de la vivienda, ella se quiere comprar una variedad de productos para el negocio como arroz, aceite, maíz, frijoles, plátanos, tomates, cebollas, y la otra parte la invertida en elaboración de puertas para su vivienda, este préstamo le ayudará no sólo a la parte económica de ella sino también a mejorar las instalaciones de la casa.
Con el préstamo anterior aumentó su inventario de venta y los productos que ofreció en los platillos fueron demandados por la clientela en este periodo ha logrado terminar la construcción de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana is requesting a new loan to invest in her business and some repairs to her home. She wants to buy a variety of products for the business, such as rice, oil, corn, beans, bananas, tomatoes, and onions. She will invest the other portion of the loan to addition of doors to her home. This loan will help her not only economically but will also improve the installations on her house.

With her earlier loan, Ana increased her sales inventory and the products that she offered in the dishes were in demand with her clientele. During this period, she finished construction of her home.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, corn, beans, bananas, tomatoes, and onions

loans.name: Nahybe

texts.es:
Nahybe es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su abuela ocupando solo una habitación  pequeña, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Villa  nueva Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz.
Ella estudió solo hasta terminar la secundaria, percibe ingresos ya que se dedica  a la venta de comida rápida trabajando por más de ocho horas al día ya que con eso solventa los gastos de alimentación, servicios básicos y gastos médicos de su familia ya que no cuenta con otros ingresos. Es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra de fideos, maní, etc. Para poder incrementar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Nahybe, es estudiar en la universidad y después independizarse ya que desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Nahybe is single, and she does not have children.  She lives in only one small room of her grandmother’s house.  The house is located in the Villa Nueva Potosí area in the city of La Paz.

She has a high school education.  She gets income from selling fast food.  She works for over eight hours a day.  She uses her income to pay the family’s food expenses, basic services, and medical expenses.  She does not have any other income.  

That is why she is requesting the loan to buy noodles and peanuts, etc. in order to be able to increase her income.

Nahybe’s dream is to attend college and later become independent.  She wants to do this in order to improve her quality of life.

It is the second time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time she has requested a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy food to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Marvin Mauricio

texts.es:
Marvín, se encuentra iniciando sus labores en el nuevo cultivo, es para esto solicita un nuevo préstamo del cual invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas como el abono, los insecticidas y los pesticidas, estudio ayudará a Marvín a contar con un necesario para continuar en su trabajo agrícola.
En manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le permitió tener buena cosecha de la cual realizó ventas, las circunstancias de su familia han mejorado debido a sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Marvín can be found starting up work on the new crop. It is for this reason that he is requesting a new loan, which he will use to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, insecticides, and pesticides. Study will help provide Marvín with a sense of necessity for continuing his agricultural work. 

He declared that the earlier loan enabled him to have a good crop, from which he made good sales—and because of his earnings, the circumstances of his family have improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and pesticides

loans.name: Dolores Margarita

texts.es:
Dolores, se dedica siempre a la venta de recuerdos, solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprarse ramos de flores, juguetes, y adornos para el hogar, que son los productos que ofrece a diario a su clientela, con esta nueva inversión espera seguir superándose en el comercio.
El decreto anterior aumentó su inventario y le permitió ofrecer novedades a los clientes, dándole una mejor condición dentro del mercado y proveyéndole mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Dolores makes a living by selling keepsake items. She is requesting another loan to buy flowers, toys, and home decorations, which are all products that she offers daily to her customers. With this new investment, she hopes to expand her business.

Her previous order increased her inventory and allowed her to offer new items to customers. It also gave her a better condition in the market and provided her with a larger income.

loans.use: to buy flowers, toys, and home decorations

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman. She has six children between the ages of 16 and 30 years old. She describes herself as creative. She operates a retail stall where she sells items such as biscuits, juices, youghurt, sweets etc. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy biscuits, yoghurt, sweets, juices, etc. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build rental houses with the profit that will be generated.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, sweets, sodas, yoghurt and juices.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.es:
Patrick es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su madre ocupando solo una habitación, la casa esta ubicada en la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz.
El estudió mecánica Automotriz, obtiene ingresos por que cuenta con un taller  mecánico trabajando por más de diez horas y a veces fines de semana es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas mecánicas ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos para estudiar Administración de empresas en la universidad  y poder ayudar a sus padres a cubrir los pagos de servicios básicos de su familia.
El sueño de Patrick, es terminar sus estudios y mejorar sus ingresos para poder independizarse y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida y ampliar su taller de mecánica.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Patrick is single, and he does not have children.  He lives in only one room in his mother’s house.  The house is located in the central area of the city of La Paz.

He studied auto mechanics, and he gets income from his mechanic’s shop.  He works for over ten hours a day, and he sometimes works on the week-ends.

He is requesting the loan to buy mechanic’s tools.  He wishes to improve his income so that he can study business administration at the university.  He wants to be able to help his father cover his family’s basic services payments.

Patrick’s dream is to finish his education and improve his income.  He dreams of doing this in order to be able to become independent, to improve his quality of life, and to expand his mechanic’s shop.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy tools for his mechanic's shop.

loans.name: Clara Celmira

texts.es: Clara es una comerciante de 55 años que vive con su compañero y su hija mayor de edad en el barrio Villa Estadio del municipio de Soledad.  Hace aproximadamente 10 años su pareja quedó sin empleo por lo cual decidieron buscar alguna alternativa de generación de ingresos.  Inicialmente, con el dinero recibido por la liquidación laboral, viajaron al municipio de Maicao en el departamento de la Guajira, zona fronteriza a donde se trasladan muchos comerciantes, para comprar víveres y productos alimenticios no perecederos a precios favorables para luego venderlos al detal principalmente entre los tenderos del barrio, amigos y conocidos.  Poco a poco fue adquiriendo nuevos clientes que le iban solicitando toda clase de artículos diferentes a alimentos así como ropa, calzado, electrodomésticos, entre otros, acreditándoles con plazos hasta de 45 días, modalidad de venta que aún conserva.  Clara conoce muy bien a sus clientes y trata de satisfacer su demanda de acuerdo a la temporada, es por esto que está solicitando su primer financiamiento para aprovechar la celebración  que se avecina del día del padre y surtirlos de perfumes, camisas, billeteras, jeans, entre otras prendas y accesorios masculinos, que distribuye en su mayoría a crédito.  Es un negocio familiar organizado de tal manera que cada uno se encarga de un segmento de clientes para asegurar así una buena atención.  Su dedicación y esfuerzo han sido factores fundamentales para cumplir sus metas, haciendo de las dificultades una oportunidad para salir adelante.  Uno de los objetivos a corto plazo es la consecución de su vivienda propia para lo cual ha venido trabajando en los últimos años junto con su familia. Se siente muy satisfecha y agradecida por todo lo que ha podido lograr hasta el momento.
texts.en: Clara is a 55-year-old shopkeeper who lives with her partner and her eldest daughter in the Villa Estadio neighborhood of the municipality of Soledad.  Around 10 years ago, her partner was left without a job and so they decided to look for an alternative source of income.  Initially, with the severance pay they received, they went to the municipality of Maicao in the department of Guajira, which is a border area that many merchants pass through, to buy foodstuffs and non-perishable food products at good prices.  They planned to resell these later at retail prices, mainly to neighborhood shopkeepers, friends, and acquaintances.  Little by little they got more customers who would ask them for all kinds of different items besides food, such as clothing, shoes, and home appliances, among other things.  They gave these customers payment periods of up to 45 days, which is still the sales policy they use.  Clara knows her customers very well and she tries to meet their demands according to the season.  This is why she is asking for her first loan to take advantage of the approaching Fathers Day celebrations by stocking colognes, shirts, wallets, and jeans, among other clothing items and men's accessories, which she mainly sells on credit.  Hers is a family business that is organized in such a way that each of them takes care of a segment of their customers to make sure they give very good customer service.  One of her short-term goals is to get her own home, which is what she and her family have been working toward for the past few years.  She is very satisfied with and thankful for everything she has been able to achieve up to this point.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, mainly men's clothing and accessories, to sell

loans.name: Edinah

texts.en:
Edinah is the mother of one child aged four years. She has been in farming for five successive years with her mixed farm producing maize and beans, which she sells to the local markets. She is a tailor too.

Edinah has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow for a venture into dairy farming. She says dairy farming will improve her farming income which has been facing challenges with crop diseases and natural calamities like hailstorms, which damage crops. She adds the milk will improve the health of her family and the manure from the dairy cows will be used in place of fertilizers.

She reiterates the challenges of crop diseases and occasional drought.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth is a 29-year-old single woman. She has a daughter who is 3 years old. She describes herself as diligent. She operates a tailoring retail store where she sells skirts, suits, trousers and dresses. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy cloth material. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will purchase land.

loans.use: to buy cloth material.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 56 years old and a single mother. She is a tailor and works in the city outskirts. She works 7 days a week, and she serves retail customers. She has been able to build small rentals out of the business to sustain her family.

This is her eighth loan which she will use to buy materials for sewing. One of the challenges she faces is that some customers, at times, are not able to make payments on time. Violet is very hard working and her dream is to flourish in this business.

loans.use: to buy material/cloth for sewing.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es soltero y no tiene hijos vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo dos habitaciones en la zona Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz.
El estudio técnico superior en el área de Electrónica y actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como cerrajero realizando todo tipo de trabajos en metal y por más de doce horas al día ya que  cubre sus gastos de alimentación y gastos médicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de sus habitaciones ya que se encuentran muy deterioradas y tienen rajaduras es por eso que desea arreglarlas y mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Luís es mejorar sus ingresos para poder independizarse y tener su propio taller ya que actualmente lo comparte con otra persona.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Luis is single, and he does not have children.  He lives in only two rooms of his parents’ house.  He lives in the Miraflores area of the city of La Paz.

He has an advanced vocational education in electronics.  He currently gets income from working as a locksmith.  He does all kinds of metal work for over 12 hours a day.  He does this to cover his food and medical expenses.

He needs the loan to repair the rooms because they are in very bad shape, and there are cracks.  That is why he wants to fix them and improve his quality of life.

Luís’s dream is to improve his income in order to be able to become independent.  He also dreams of having his own shop, which he currently shares with another person.

This is the second time he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to repair his rooms.

loans.name: Martha Agueda

texts.es:
La señora Martha Agueda tiene un negocio de ventas de refresco naturales, se levanta muy de mañanita para ir al mercado a comprar frutas frescas para la elaboración de sus deliciosos refrescos naturales para satisfacer la demanda su clientela.

El  crédito solicitado a Ceprodel será utilizado para compra de utensilios para obtener mejores condiciones en su puesto de trabajo, ella se siente agradecida ya que a logrando incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Martha Agueda has a business selling natural sodas. She rises very early in the morning in order to go to the market to buy fresh fruit to make her delicious natural sodas and to satisfy the demands of her clientele. 

The loan requested from Ceprodel will be used to buy utensils in order to attain better conditions in her workplace. She feels grateful to be increasing her work capital.

loans.use: to buy sugar, plastic bags, drinking straws, and plastic thermoses

loans.name: Lylian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lylian, tiene la necesidad de invertir nuevamente en negocio ya que quiere surtirlo de mayor mercadería como huevos, aceite, arroz, galletas, boquitas, gaseosas, que son productos demandados a diario por sus clientes con lo que  espera mantener su preferencia.
Ella manifiesta el decreto anterior le permitió crecer tener nuevos productos y mejores ingresos esto ha cambiado las circunstancias familiares teniendo mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Lylian needs to invest in her business again. She wants to stock up on more products such as eggs, oil, rice, biscuits, snacks and soft drinks. She hopes that, if she keeps providing her customers with the goods they want, they will keep coming back to her shop. 

Lylian says that the previous loan allowed her to acquire new products and increase her income, which has improved her family’s circumstances.

loans.use: to buy eggs, oil, rice, biscuits, snacks and soft drinks

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has a daughter who is 1 year old. He describes himself as an honest man. He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as sugar, salt, tea leaves, rice, cooking fat, sodas etc. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located within a potential business environment and his primary customers are retailers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of household items. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more home retail products. His business goal is to run a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy home products.

loans.name: Saidboy

texts.ru: Саидбой мужчина в возрасте 56 лет, он женат  у него 5 детей.Он сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2007 года. Он торгует на рынке фруктами и овощами. Он прадает  капусту, морковь, свеклу и картошку. В зависимости от спроса и сезона, его ассортимент изменяется время о времени. Его лавка находиться на выгодном и многолюдном месте рынка. Настоящий кредит получет для расширения ассортимента товаров. Он планирует пополнить свою ларек другим овощами и фруктами. У него есть определенные поставщики овощей, которые привозят прямо с огорода.
texts.en: Saidboi is 56 years old, married, and has five children. He has been working with MDO Arvand, LLC since 2007. He sells fruit and vegetables at the market. He sells cabbage, carrots, beets and potatoes. His inventory changes from time to time, depending on demand and the season. His shop is located in a favorable and busy section in the market. He has requested this loan to expand his assortment of products. He plans to add more types of fruits and vegetables to his stall. He has reliable suppliers who deliver produce direct from their gardens.

loans.use: expand his assortment of products

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es casado y tiene tres hijos con  los cuales vive en casa propia la cual tiene solo cuatro habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Ciudadela Ferroviaria en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica al transporte urbano trabajando por más de doce horas al día debido a que cubre  los gastos de alimentación, educación y servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la conversión a gas de su vehiculo ya que es más económico y es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Juan es construir más habitaciones para dar más comodidad a su familia y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Juan is married and has three children.  They live in their own house, which only has four rooms.  The house is located in the Ciudadela Ferroviaria area of the city of La Paz.

He currently gets income by working in urban transportation for over 12 hours a day.  He does this to cover his family’s expenses for food, education, and basic services.

He needs the loan to convert his vehicle to gas, which is more economical.  It is the only source of income that he has to support his family.

Juan’s dream is to build more rooms to make his family more comfortable. This way he will improve their quality of life.

This is the fourth time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time he has requested a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to convert his vehicle to gas.

loans.name: Dilia

texts.es:
Dilia es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a uno de sus hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande. La zona tiene un clima semi – tropical, propicio para el desarrollo de las plantaciones de frutas como el mango y el limón. Se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura.

Se dedica a la venta de chicha (bebida tradicional hecha en base a maíz), cerveza y piqueos en su domicilio los fines de semana. Esta actividad cuenta con bastante acogida ya que los pobladores de la zona siempre salen a departir entre amigos durante esos días. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral y de cabras, las cuales eventualmente vende a sus vecinos y a los negociantes de la zona. Los ingresos que obtiene de estas actividades los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Dilia desea adquirir un refrigerador para brindar sus bebidas heladas y así satisfacer aún más la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante abnegada y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Dilia agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyarán a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Dilia is a 43-year-old mother. She lives with her husband and one of her children in one of the small villages that make up Tambogrande, an agricultural area in the Piura region. The area has a semi-tropical climate, which makes it a good place for growing fruit such as mangoes and lemons.  
Dilia’s job is selling chicha (a traditional maize-based drink), beer and snacks from her home at weekends.  It is a busy job, since the local people always go out to meet up with friends at weekends. Dilia also breeds poultry and goats, which she can then sell to neighbours and local businesses. She uses her income from these businesses to help her husband, who is a farmer, to support the family. 

Dilia has applied for a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can to buy a refrigerator. She would like respond to customer demand for cold drinks, and she believes a loan would help her to do this.

She is a very selfless and hardworking woman. Her main wish is to keep growing her business so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life. Dilia would like to thank Kiva's lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator so that she can grow her business selling drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a 24-year-old married man. He has a daughter who is 2 months old. He describes himself to be a very hardworking man. He operates a beauty salon where he sells home products and provides hair services with the help of his wife whom he works with in the salon. He has been involved in this business for 6 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located within a potential business environment with minimal competition and his primary customers are retailers and ladies. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of beauty products. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy beauty products. His business goal is to expand his salon business and create more job opportunities for people within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will run a retail cosmetic shop.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Ganxhe

texts.en:
Ganxhe’s permanent residence has always been in a little town in Northern Albania. She is single, in her forties and highly educated. However, she never found a job in her field and she has been involved in the livestock and poultry business for a long time now. 

She has turkeys and cows and sells milk, calves and small baby turkeys. This business has proved to be successful and equally enjoyable. She has been able to establish a strong clientele within her district. Being aware of the demands for what she offers and seeing the positive results of her work, she planned to expand. 

Ganxhe started to build a stable and a hutch recently, with the intention of having all of her animals fit nicely within it. However, at the first stages of building she realized that she was a little short on money and this made her to apply for a loan through VisionFund Albania. 

She has no doubt that with the amount of loan she is requesting she will be able to finish off the building. She is also responsible and her confidence in paying off the loan remains high.

loans.use: To finish off building the stable and hutch

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is a 37-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He is a parish chief and has been in service for five years. His hardship is that his work station is far away from home and he incurs a lot of money on transportation. His business goal is to buy land to grow crops so as to supplement his salary. Justus wants money to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cassava flour for sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 46-year-old married woman with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a nurse and is so proud of her profession since she works in her home area. Her challenge is low pay and her dream is to open up a drug shop. She also has a dream to educate her children to higher institutions of learning. The purpose of the loan is to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with five children. She is 49 years old and lives in Maular, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Evelyn runs a general store business. She has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more stocks for her general store. Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

She hopes to own a mini grocery someday in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia is married with four children. She is 64 years old and lives in Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental .

To earn a living, Venancia has a hog-fattening business. She has had this business for 6 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 2,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase feeds and piglets. She has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.

Venancia hopes to expand her business someday in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and piglets.

loans.name: Jerald

texts.en: Jerald is a 34-year-old married man. He has two children with ages ranging from 2 years to 4 years old. He describes himself to be a self-aggressive man. He operates a retail stall where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located on a busy street and his primary customers are passengers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high transportation costs. He will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy one bale of clothes. His business goal is to run a wholesale retail shop within five years. He hopes that in the future he will run a permanent business premise.

loans.use: to buy one bale of clothing for selling.

loans.name: Edicta Argentina

texts.es:
Edicta, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus 4 hijos en una aldea de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.
Hace 7 años que doña Edicta estableció su propio negocio de donde obtiene los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Ella vende productos alimenticios en una pulpería como ser: huevos, lácteos, churros, refrescos, harina, azúcar, frijoles y productos de abarrotería. Con los dos préstamos anteriores a podido incrementar su inventario y mantenerlo estable. Actualmente solicita el tercer préstamo de 13,000.00 Lempiras con el cual va surtir de varios productos comestibles para ofrecer siempre a sus clientes. Su meta es crecer en el negocio para que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y llegar a tener algo para su vejez.
texts.en:
Edicta, age 44, is a single mother.  She lives with her four children in a the village of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.

Seven years ago Edicta established her own business where she gets the income to support her family.  She sells food products in a grocery store.  She sells things like eggs, dairy products, churros, soft drinks, flour, sugar, beans, and grocery products.

With the two previous loans she has been able to increase her inventory and keep it stable.  She is currently requesting her third loan for 13,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to stock various food products to offer her customers.

Her goal is to grow in the business so that her children can finish their education and so that she can have something for her old age.

loans.use: to buy staple food products to stock her business.

loans.name: Donisa

texts.en:
Donisa is married with one child. She is 30 years old and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City.

To earn a living, Donisa has a used clothing business. She has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 5,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase a bundle of used clothing to sell. Donisa has been a member of PMPC for two years.

She hopes to expand her business in nearby towns in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with three children. She is 39 years old and lives in Tawi-tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

She sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase ingredients to make banana-based snacks and other snack items.

Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to own a mini refreshment shop someday.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to stock up her store.

loans.name: Nueva

texts.en:
Nueva is 43 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children. 

She has a manicure and pedicure business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month. She has a requested a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase equipments for her beauty salon business.
 
Nueva has been a member of PMPC for almost 8 years.

loans.use: purchase equipments for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Jose Ismael

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, pues considera haber recibido un buen servicio con el préstamo anterior, en esta ocasión está iniciando la siembra del cultivo de la temporada, para lo cual se comprará cinco sacos de abono, tres de sulfato y dos de herbicidas también comprará una bolsa de pesticidas, con estos materiales el dara inició a su nueva siembra, de la cual su objetivo es obtener una buena cosecha.
Con el préstamo anterior mejoró su producción, aunque en el invierno no fue tan favorable pero logró salir adelante con su familia, y esto le ha permitido mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en: Jose has decided to get a new loan, believing that he was well served by the previous loan. Now he's starting this season's planting. For that he will buy five bags of fertilizer, three of sulfate, and two of herbicides. He will also buy a sack of pesticides. With those materials he will start the new crop, and his goals is to have a good harvest. With the previous loan he improved his production since in the winter isn't so favorable, but he and his family were able to get ahead and this allowed him to improve their financial situation.

loans.use: to buy five bags of fertilizer, three of sulfate, and two of herbicides.

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru: Рохат женщина в возрасте 41 года,она замужем и имеет четверых детей.Она занимается выращиванием скота,ее муж работает в дехканском хозяйстве.Рохат занимается в этой сфере деятельности около 15 лет и уже знает все преимушество этого бизнеса. Она покупает крупно рогатый скот  с рынка и  откормив их  продает  на том же рынке по дороже. Ей конечно же  помогает ее муж.Это их единственный доход в семье и они стараются на этом деле накопить денег и улучшить свои условия проживания.  Рохат на полученный кредит хочет приобрести скот и расширить свой бизнес.Заранее благодорит организацию за поддержку.
texts.en: Rokhat is 41 years old, married, and has four children. She raises livestock, and her husband is a farmer. Rokhat has doing this type of work for about 15 years, and already knows all of the advantages of this business. She buys cattle at the market, raises and fattens them, and then sells them for a profit at the same market. Of course her husband helps her. This is their single source of family income, and they are trying to save enough money to improve their standard of living. Rokhat plans to use the loan to purchase more livestock and expand the business. She thanks MDO Arvand, LLC in advance for its support.

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 3 children and 2 of her children are in school. She does not take care of other additional family members.

She sells green bananas from home. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in business for the last 5 years.

She has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are thieves and defaulters. Her dream is to educate her children to university and also to build her own house. She lives in a tented house and  the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses includes school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 46 years old and lives in San Isidro, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. 

She has a snack-vending business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase feeds for hog-raising, which is a secondary business.
 
Lilibeth has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. She hopes to get engaged in another business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is married with 3 children. She is 33 years old and lives in Talic, Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Marichu has a furniture making business. She has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 2,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000. 

Marichu has been a member of PMPC for one year, and she hopes to have a better future someday.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her furniture business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 52  años de edad, es viudo y vive junto a una de sus hijas. La comunidad en donde reside es uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Mórrope, una zona conocida por su población humilde, trabajadora y que aún conserva sus tradiciones cotidianas, popias de los antiguos pobladores de la zona.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y comercialización de animales menores desde hace doce años. El cría los animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes de la zona. Adicionalmente cuenta con una moto carguera (en la fotografía) con la cual brinda servicio de transporte de carga en la zona.

Juan desea incrementar sus ingresos adquiriendo una mototaxi usada (motocicleta que lleva adjunta una cabina para transporte de pasajeros) con la cual planea efectuar actividades de transporte en su zona, una actividad con bastante demanda, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un hombre bastante trabajador y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona de confianza. Juan agradece de antemano a las personas que le ayudarán a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Juan is 52 years old, widowed and lives with one of his daughters. The community he lives in is one of the hamlets that makes up the agricultural district of Mórrope, an area know for its humble and hard-working population that still maintains its everyday traditions unique to the old settlers of the area.

Juan has been raising and selling small animals for the last twelve years. He raises the animals behind his home and when they have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to his neighbors and the business people in the area. He also has a motorcycle truck (shown in the photograph) with which he provides transportation services in the area.
 
Juan wants to increase his income by acquiring a used rickshaw (motorcycle that has a cab attached to transport passengers) with which he plans to undertake a transportation business in the area, a business for which there is much demand. Therefore, he has requested a loan of 1000 new Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

He is quite a hard-working man that really wants to get ahead. People that know him consider him trustworthy. Juan thanks in advance the people that will help him through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a used rickshaw for a transportation business.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan, se dedica a la siembra de arroz en las afueras de Teustepe, es padre de dos hijos de 6 y 3 años respectivamente. Su experiencia en la agricultura la adquirió de muchos años atrás cuando cuidaba ganado, después se fue a trabajar en una empresa arrocera donde el participa en el proceso de siembra hasta llegar a ser un producto terminado listo para venderse. Todo esto contribuyo a que el comenzara a sembrar su propia parcela de tierra. Comenzó sembrando ½ manzana de tierra trabajo muy duro y requirió mucho sacrifico pero valió la pena pues hoy en día tiene 2 manzanas de tierra, además  el vende granos básicos esto le ayuda a sostener los gastos del hogar. El no vende toda su producción fuera de la comunidad donde vive pues los costos de transporte y venta son muy altos para el así que solo lo vende ahí mismo en la comarca.  Está solicitando un crédito Kiva para sembrar 1 manzana adicional  de arroz, esto le ayudara ampliar más sus aéreas de siembras y mejorar sus ingresos. Sus planes futuros es comprar un motor de riego y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Juan cultivates rice on the outskirts of Teustepe.  His is the father of 2 children, aged 6 and 3.  He acquired his experience in agriculture many years ago when he used to raise livestock.  Later, he went to work in a rice company where he was involved in the process from the planting until the point at which the product is ready to be sold.  With all of this experience, he started cultivating his own parcel of land.  He started cultivating half a manzana (a little less than an acre) of land.  He worked very hard, and it required a lot of sacrifice, but it was worth it, because now he has 2 manzanas of land.  He also sells staple grains to help cover the household expenses.  He doesn't sell his products outside the community where he lives because the transportation and selling costs are very high.  So he sells only in the same region where he lives.  He is requesting a loan from Kiva to cultivate another manzana of rice.  This will help him to farm on more land, and thus increase his income.  In the future, he plans to buy an irrigation motor and make some improvements to his house.

loans.use: to cultivate rice on an additional plot of land

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es: María Antonieta se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, actividad que la inicio como  iniciativa propia para sufragar gastos, el negocio lo vende de forma ambulante  Ahora solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, ropa de niños, sabanas , ropa interior  entre otros.
texts.en: María Antonieta has a business selling general merchandise.  She started this business on her own initiative to defray the household expenses.  She sells her products from place to place.  She now requests a new loan to buy: pants, shirts, children's clothing, bed linens, underwear, and other items.

loans.use: to buy: pants, shirts, children's clothing, bed linens, underwear, and other items.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 46 years old and lives in Conat, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

She works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more fish to sell.

Jessie has been a member of PMPC for two years, and she hopes to own a stall in the public market in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 44 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

She has a manicure and pedicure business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional nail polish, coloring and other manicure/pedicure materials. 

Lenie has been a member of PMPC for one year and she hopes to build her own beauty shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional nail polish, coloring and other manicure/pedicure materials.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 28-year-old married man. He describes himself to be an aggressive man. He operates a farm where he sells milk and eggs. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located within a suitable business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay for the construction of a manger. His business goal is to be a large-scale milk supplier within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have many cows.

loans.use: to pay for renovations and repairs of a manger

loans.name: David

texts.en: David wants a loan to buy another motorcycle. He is 46 years old, lives in Masindi, Uganda, and is charged with the responsibility of taking care of his three children. He is in the transport business, specifically riding a motorcycle. He desires to educate his children and expand the business into new markets. Price fluctuations and inflation affects his business.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en:
Jovia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother of three children, of which two attend school. She does not take care of other family members.

She operates a beauty salon from her house. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works six days a week and has been in business for the past five years.
