She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy hair oils, treatments, weaves, relaxers and braids. Her major business challenge is transportation and electricity. 

Her dream is to provide university education for her children and also own a fully-stocked salon. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no access to piped water. Her major monthly expense includes school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: to buy hair oil, relaxers, braids, weaves and hair treatments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer for homework

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 46 years old and has four children and they live in Masindi, Uganda. He runs a butcher shop and the business is very lucrative since demand for meat is high. Henry wants a loan to buy cows to sell. 

Inadequate capital and theft hinder his business. He has been in the butchering business for 10 years. He desires to educate his children and buy land to grow crops in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 68-year-old married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 29 years to 38 years. He describes himself to be a determined man. He operates a quarry where he sells building stones. He has been involved in this business for 20 years and employs 4 staff members. His business is located at a suitable quarry area and his primary customers are masons. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition in the area. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay rent at the quarry. His business goal is to venture into the transportation industry within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have diversified his business.

loans.use: to pay rent in a quarry

loans.name: Agileo

texts.en:
Agileo is aged 39 with five children living in Masindi, Uganda. He started by farming and after a good harvest he sold the proceeds and started a retail shop. He desires to educate his children and buy land to grow crops.

His business faces problems of price fluctuations and high rental costs. Agileo wants a loan to buy general merchandise, such as soap and salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as soap and salt for selling

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is a 48-year-old married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 18 years. He describes himself to be a determined man. He operates a quarry where he sells building stones. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located at a suitable quarry area and his primary customers are masons and local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more drilling tools. His business goal is to run a well-established business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have expanded his business.

loans.use: to buy more drilling tools

loans.name: Ganyenda Tumanyane Group

texts.en: Rauben is a forty-six-year-old married man with five children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children to attain degrees for their minimum qualification. He has been a farmer for the last three years after starting with a capital of 150,000 shillings and now has over 2,000,000 shillings. His main hardship is price fluctuation and inflation; however, he has a vision of buying land to grow crops. Rauben needs a loan to buy maize for resale. He is a member of the above mentioned group where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan. Some of the members did not take the loan but had to comply with the group policy.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Kabirizi Catholic S &c Group

texts.en:
Deus is a fifty-five-year-old hardworking man with five children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children up to the University. He has a drug shop business. He started with a capital of 100,000 shillings and now has capital worth 800,000 shillings. He faces hardships of inadequate capital to buy enough drugs for resale. He has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming and owning a pharmacy. 

Deus needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a thirty-year-old married woman with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. She is a teacher and has been teaching for two years now. Her personal goals are educating children and building a permanent house for residence. Veronica wants money to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a fifty-six-year-old hardworking man with eight children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been a farmer for the last twenty years, after using savings from his monthly salary. His main hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, seasonal weather, and high fuel and transportation costs. Besides that, he has a vision of buying land to grow crops and hiring employees to help expand his business. Robert needs a loan to buy maize and pay workers who are weeding the banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy maize and pay workers who are weeding the banana plantation

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Tanto el señor Hugo como su esposa trabajan en la venta de los elotes, eventualmente el sr Hugo trabaja como transfer para una empresa que radica en Laredo Texas.
El Sr. Hugo desea comprar mercancía al por mayor. La cual incluye las desechables mayonesas salsas, y también poder comprar elotes en mayor cantidad.
Principalmente podrá vender más al tener más producto a su disposición y así podrá tener mayores ingresos
texts.en: Hugo and his wife work selling elotes (roasted corn topped with condiments such as mayonnaise, cheese and chili powder).   Hugo also works in transportation for a company that is located in Laredo, Texas.  Hugo wants to buy merchandise at wholesale.  He will buy disposable plates, mayonnaise, and sauces, and he will also buy corn in bulk.  This will allow him to have more products available to sell, so he can increase his income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make food to sell

loans.name: Humphrey

texts.en:
Humphrey is a farmer in Nkubu area of central Kenya, where he lives with his wife and carries out farming on his farm. The farm currently produces milk and tea, which he sells to earn income to meet his family's daily needs. He also operates a motorcycle transport business to supplement his farming income. He runs his farm with one farmhand.

Humphrey has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank and irrigation installation pipes. He says this will help him harvest water as well as supply his farm during low rains. His focus is to improve the living standards of his family and strongly believes farming will make this a possibility.

He laments on high costs of farm inputs and inadequate rains.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and irrigation pipes

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a twenty-one-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His personal goal is to build a permanent house for residence. He has been operating a retail shop for the last three years. His main hardship is customers not paying on time. Besides that, he has a vision of expanding his business to new markets. Gerald needs a loan to buy more bags of sugar for resale.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar for resale

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother with five children, four of whom attend school. She is looking after three grandchildren.

She has had restuarant at her home for ten years and does wholesale selling for her products from door-to-door. She works seven days a week. She earns additional income from sales of her farm produce.

She has requested for a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to increase stock to more sacks of rice, beans, and cartons of cooking oil. Her challenges include seasonality of the market and having to move from door-to-door in order to sell her products. Her dream is to capture a bigger market for her business. She was attracted to join MCDT by the low interest charged on loans. She stays in a house on her father's land, with no access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans, and cartons of cooking oil

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She is also looking after an orphan.

She has been selling charcoal at her home for five years at retail, working seven days a week. She also operates a grocery for additional income.

Robinah has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to increase stock with more sacks of charcoal for sale. Her challenges include seasonality of supply, high prices, and transport costs. Her dream is to expand her business and start selling at wholesale. She joined MCDT to boost her charcoal business. She rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Andrea Gabriela

texts.es:
Andrea es una joven muy trabajadora y sobre todo con mucho entusiasmo, tiene 21 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y es conocida como la tierra del sol eterno, en ella se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo algodón, esparrago, uva, paprika, entre otros. Andrea es una joven muy alegre y cuando tiene un pequeño tiempo libre le gusta mucho escuchar música, ya que le ayuda a relajarse y a distraerse, uno de sus platillos favoritos son los riquísimos Tallarines Rojos con papas a la huancaína. Con las ganas de salir adelante Andrea trabaja momo cajera en un grifo de su ciudad y con el fruto de su trabajo ella puede estudiar la carrera de analista de sistemas; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque es muy honrada y los clientes siempre la recomiendan.

Andrea está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá pagar algunos gastos de la universidad , lo que le permitirá continuar sus estudios y poder seguir trabajando y luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una casa propia y ser una gran profesional”.
texts.en: Andrea is a very hardworking young woman and above all she is very enthusiastic. She is 21 years old and lives in the city of Ica, a city that is characterized for having a very warm weather and it is known as the land of the eternal sun. Agricultural development takes place there, specially the cultivation of cotton, asparagus, grapes and paprika, among others. Andrea is a very happy young woman and when she has some spare time she likes to listen to music, since it helps her to relax and unwind. One of her favorite meals is the delicious red tagliatelle with huancaína potatoes. With her will to get ahead in life, Andrea works as a cashier in a gas station and with the fruits of her labor she manages to study to get her degree as a systems analyst. She thinks she does well at her job because she is very responsible and above all because she is very honest and customers always recommend her. Andrea is very thankful to Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to pay for some university expenses, which will allow her to continue studying and keep working and fighting every day to make her biggest dream come true: "Have a house of her own and become a great professional".

loans.use: to pay for university expenses

loans.name: Dalila Del Carmen

texts.es: Dalila Del Carmen casada con 57  años de edad , su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio, con el paso del tiempo es que ha ido creciendo gradualmente ella es una persona muy responsable que disfruta de su actividad económica. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de cremas, polvos, lápiz labial, cremas corporales, bases, rubor, antiarrugas, entre otros
texts.en: Dalila Del Carmen is married and is 57 years old. She sells cosmetics for a living. She has had this business for over 11 years. As time went by, it has gradually grown. She is a very responsible person who enjoys her business activity. The loan she is asking for is to buy creams, powders, lipstick, body creams, foundations, blush and anti-wrinkle creams among others.

loans.use: to buy creams, powders, lipstick, body creams, foundations, blush and anti-wrinkle creams, among others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry birds

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She is not looking after any additional family members.

She has been charging and selling all kinds of batteries from her home for the last ten years and works seven days a week. She also runs a grocery store to earn additional income.

Rose has requested a loan of UGX 700,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more batteries for sale. Her challenges include high costs and seasonality. Her dream is to put up a big shop in the area. She joined MCDT because of the low capital that she had. She rents a house with access to electricity, but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more batteries for charging

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, four of whom attend school. She also looks after her mother.
She has been selling green bananas from the market at wholesale for the last seven years and works two days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested for a loan of UGX 800,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more green bananas for sale. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to accumulate enough profits that will enable her to eliminate the middleman for yet higher profits. She joined MCDT in order to raise more capital for her business. She stays in her house with access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expense is school fees .

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Adalberto Bernardino

texts.es:
Adalberto es un hombre de 51 años, soltero, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, en sus ratos libres le gusta montar a caballo acompañado de sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo “Picante de Cochayuyo”, plato típico de su ciudad; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera de veterinaria.

Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y a sus ganas de salir adelante, Adalberto se dedica a la agricultura, él cuenta con un  terreno en el cual cultiva frejoles, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diaria, Adalberto se encuentra muy a gusto en su negocio, ya que siempre le ha gustado mucho las labores del campo, ya que sus padres se dedicaban a la agricultura y él crecio aprendiendo esta actividad.
Adalberto se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abono, fertilizantes y podrá realizar el mantenimiento de su cultivo; de esta manera podrá sostener la cosecha de su cultivo e incrementar sus ingresos y en un futuro no muy lejano, espera poder comprar ganado para iniciar otro negocio.
texts.en: Adalberto is 51 years old, single, and lives in the city of Camaná.  In his spare time he likes horseback riding with his friends and sometimes cooking a delicious "Spicy Cochayuyo", a typical dish of his city.  Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources he could not attend university, but would have liked very much to pursue a career in veterinary medicine. Thanks to his entrepreneurial spirit and his desire to succeed, Adalberto work in agriculture and has a field in which he grows beans, working approximately 12 hours a day.  Adalberto is very comfortable in his business as he has always liked working in the fields, since their parents worked in agriculture and he grew up learning this activity. Adalberto is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, and thanks to this help, will purchase fertilizer and can perform maintenance on his crops.  This way, he will be able to sustain crop cultivation and increase his income and in the not-too-distant future, he hopes to buy cattle to start another business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzer and maintain his crop.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children five of whom attend school. She is also looking after three grand children.
She has been making brushes and brooms from home and selling them wholesale for the last thirty years and works six days a week. She also teaches to earn additional income.

She has requested for a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy materials for making brushes and brooms. Her challenges include high costs. Her dream is to capture all the market in her area. She joined MCDT because of low interest charged on loans. She resides in her husband`s house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more materials for brush making.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has been active in farming for two successive years in his rural home in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya where he lives with his parents. He is aged 23 and currently produces tea, vegetables and fruits for the local market.

Patrick has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him install an irrigation system in his farm for better farming water pipes and a water tank. He says he wants to save his farming income to enable him build decent house for his family and establish a fish farming business.

He laments the high cost of farm inputs and costly management of animal crops.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and water pipes for irrigation.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother with one child who currently attends school. She also looks after two of her sisters. She rents a house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.
Annet has been selling milk on a retail basis for two years. She sells by moving from door to door and works seven days a week. She is also employed as a cleaner to earn additional income.
Annet has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO to buy more milk and milk cans and to start selling wholesale. Her business challenges include thieves and an unreliable electricity supply. Her dream is to own a milk plant and employ people to sell her milk from door to door, instead of doing this herself. Annet joined MCDT SACCO because she had little capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy milk for resale and milk cans.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother with four children, one of whom attends school. She also looks after her elderly mother. Mariam rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are rent and school fees.
Mariam has been frying snacks for four years to retail in the market, and she works seven days a week. She does not have an additional source of income.
She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO to enable her to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil in bulk. Her challenges include thieves and the seasonality of the market. Her dream is to grow her business so that she accumulates a lot of money. Mariam joined MCDT SACCO because of the low interest rate charged on loans.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a mother and a farmer in Kisii, South Rift, Kenya, where she resides with her family of three children, two of whom are still juniors and schooling. She has been in farming for 12 years. She runs her farm with the help of one farm worker and produces coffee, tea and maize for the local market.
Josephine has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. She says this will improve her farming income, which she intends to channel into a poultry farming venture besides meeting her family's basic daily needs. She laments bad weather, pests and dairy animal diseases as her major business challenges.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Victo

texts.en:
Victo lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children who are currently attending school. She also looks after her parents. She rents a house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses are rent and school fees.
Victo has been selling clothes in the market for the last three years, working six days a week. She does not have an additional source of income. She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO to purchase more clothes for resale. Her business challenges include the seasonality of the market. 
Victo's dream is to grow her business so that she improves her standard of living. She joined MCDT SACCO because she wanted to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria tiene 43 años y es muy trabajadora, desde pequeña sus padres le enseñaron que con trabajo y esfuerzo se puede lograr muchas cosas y por ello ella siempre se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor,  es conocida como la tierra del sol eterno y en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, paprika, entre otros; también se encuentra la laguna de Huacachina, la cual es visitada por muchos turistas en cualquier época del año. Cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho salir a pasear para descansar un poco y sobre todo relajarse, pero en ocasiones le gusta disfrutar de su platillo favorito el cual es la riquísima “pachamanca”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser profesora.

Día a día Maria trabaja en su negocio de venta de chocotejas, tejas y lava ropa, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 5 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el día, cuando son festividades de su ciudad ella trabaja un poco mas elaborando sus chocotejas y tejas ya que es un dulce típico y siempre los turistas compran mucho; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque tiene muy buena sazón para la preparación de los dulces y también porque es responsable y cuidadosa cuando realiza su trabajo de lavado de ropa por ello los clientes siempre la recomiendan.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayudas que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una lavadora, lo que le permitirá poder realizar un mejor servicio y también poder lavar mas ropa, también podrá comprar insumos para la elaboración de sus tejas y chocotejas como leche, mantequilla chocolate, pecanas, entre otros; así ella seguirá luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir su casa de material noble”.
texts.en: Maria is 43 years old and is a very hard working woman. Ever since she was a little girl, her parents taught her that with hard work and effort lots of things can be achieved, that is why she always makes an effort to get ahead. Her home is located in the city of Ica, city that is characterized for having a warm weather. It is known as the land of the eternal sun. Agricultural development takes place there, specially the cultivation of cotton, asparagus, grapes and paprika, among others. Also here is the Huacachina Lake which is visited by lots of tourists at all times of the year. When she has some spare time, Maria likes to go for a walk to rest a little bit and above all to relax, but sometimes she likes to enjoy her favorite meal, the delicious “pachamanca”. Because of her scarce financial resources she only attended secondary school, but she would have liked to study to become a teacher. Every day Maria works in her business selling chocotejas, tejas and washing clothes. She works in her business around 5 hours per day and she can service up to 10 customers each day. During her city's holidays she works some more time making chocotejas and tejas, which is a typical confectionery, and tourists always buy a lot. She believes she does well at her job because she has good cooking skills for making sweets and also because she is responsible and careful when she does laundry, which is why customers always recommend her. Maria is very thankful to Kiva lenders since thanks to the help provided she will be able to buy a new washing machine, which will allow her to provide a better service and also do more laundry. She will also be able to buy supplies to make tejas and chocotejas such as milk, chocolate butter and pecans, among others. So she will continue fighting to make her biggest dream come true: "Build her house out of noble materials".

loans.use: to buy a washing machine and supplies (milk, chocolate butter, pecans, among others)

loans.name: Maggie

texts.en:
Maggie lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother with three children; only one who is eligible for school currently attends school. She is not looking after any additional family members.

She has been running a shop for the last three years in retail, working six days a week. She does not have an additional source of income.

She has requested for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock rice and sugar for sale. Her challenges include seasonality of the market and fluctuating prices. Her dream is to expand her business. She joined MCDT because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She rents a house with access to electricity and without piped water. Her major monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more rice and sugar

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nyamanya

texts.en:
Nyamanya is a father of five children, all of school-going ages. He is age 29. He has been in active farming since he became an adult and reiterates farming has always been the source of livelihood for his family. His farm produces maize, milk and beans for the local markets.

Nyamanya has requested a loan of 41,600 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He plans to use the income to start a cereals retail and milk palour businesses in the local market as well as educate his children.

Nyamanya says occasional floods in the area results into big losses in crops, coupled with poor local markets which compels farmer to reach out for distant markets.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She has one child. Mary owns a retail shop, which she has run for the last ten years. In addition to this business, Mary also owns a bar. She started the two business investments from her personal savings. 
Mary was introduced to Kiva partner Milango by her friends and she joined in order to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 73,100 KES to add furniture to her bar business and retail stock to her shop, e.g. eggs, diapers and bulbs. She believes the business has a bright future and even intends to repay the loan in a short time to qualify for a higher loan for future plans. 
Despite the challenge of high transportation costs and inflation, Mary aspires to grow her retail business into wholesale. She will use the additional income obtained from the business for advertising her business and carrying out minor repairs.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her bar and stock for her shop, e.g. eggs, diapers and bulbs.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en: Makvala is 62 years old. She lives in a small village in the Baghdati District with her family: her husband, Grigol, and her 12 year old son who studies in a village school. The family runs an agricultural business. They have two milking cows and produce cheese. Part of the produced cheese is used by the family and the rest is sold to a merchant. Also, they have a one hectare of vineyard. Makvala and her husband make wine in the autumn and sell it in nearby villages. The family has 50 nut-trees, which they pick in late summer and sell them locally. The family's total average monthly income is 600 Lari. Makvala requested a loan to purchase a tractor. Her husband will be busy with the tractor; he will use it to provide agricultural services to local farmers in return for a service fee. This will positively influence the family's income. With the increased income they plan to repair their house to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor.

loans.name: Keren

texts.en:
Keren wants a loan to buy soda and beer to sell.She is 40 years old and lives in Masindi-Uganda.

She is single and has the responsibility of eight children. She has a bar, and she started the business after selling two of her cows. Inadequate capital to purchase stock and high taxes hinder her business. She desires to expand her business into new markets and own a hotel.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is 39 years old and married with five children. For the last 12 years, he has been in the transport business. His parents had given him the capital to start the business. His dream is to educate his children and buy land to grow crops. High fuel and transportation costs and motorcycle break-down are some of the factors that hinder his business. Joseph intends to use the loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a single mother with one child who is attending school. She is also looking after her niece. Julia has been frying snacks at a shop which she has been renting for over five years. She sells at retail prices and works six days a week. She does not have an additional source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 2,500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more ingredients, like sacks of Irish potatoes, charcoal, eggs, cooking oil and chicken. Her challenges include high prices and transport costs. Her dream is to expand her business and start selling wholesale. 

She joined MCDT because of convenience. She rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes, charcoal, eggs, cooking oil and chicken.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She looking after additional members of the family (her father and mother). She has been selling bananas from home at retail for five years and works six days a week. She also sells porridge and charcoal to earn additional income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 700,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more bunches of bananas and to start selling wholesale. Her challenges include high transport costs. Her dream is to become a wholesaler of charcoal. She joined MCDT because of the school fees loans that they give out. She rents a house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.en:
Fabian is a father of three children, with the first born being an adult and the other two still juniors in school and aged 16 and 9 years. He runs his farm with the help of one farmhand and produces milk and bananas for the local markets.

Fabian has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to build a zero grazing unit for his dairy animals and stores both for farm produce and for animal feeds. He says the stores will help manage his produce for selling when market prices are favorable as well as keep dairy animal feeds to be used during dry seasons. He plans to buy more land to expand his farming business for better income to educate the last born children.

He commends the Juhudi Kilimo services.

loans.use: To build a zero-grazing unit and farm storage units.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 40 years old. She lives in a small village in Baghdati District with her family: two children (two and three years old) and her mother-in-law, who is a pensioner. Nino is a widow; she has had to deal with great difficulties throughout her life, but her determination to get ahead has always allowed her to overcome them. 
Nino and her mother-in-law earn their living through their agricultural business. They have three milking cows and produce dairy food: cheese, curds, and yogurt. They also have a vineyard on one hectare of land. After harvesting, part of the grapes are sold and the other part is used for wine production. They sell dairy produce, grapes and their own wine on the local open market. In addition to their agricultural business, Nino has a regular job as a teacher in a primary class in the village school. She works hard but her family's income is not sufficient even for everyday expenses. The total average monthly income of the family is 300 Lari (GEL).   
Nino has requested a loan to purchase agricultural land. She plans to cultivate the land and sow maize. After the seasonal works are properly done she hopes to increase her harvest and this will increase sales from her business. With the increased amount of profit she will be able to repair two rooms in the house and spend more on satisfying the daily needs of family members and improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is 31 years old. She lives in a small village of Baghdati District with her family: her husband Jondo, two children (5 and 6 years old) and her mother-in-law, who is a pensioner. Tea and her husband are busy with agricultural activities. They have 5 milking cows and 0.5 hectare of vineyard. They produce cheese and sell it on the local open market. During spring and summer seasons they perform seasonal agricultural works to get a good harvest. In fall they pick grapes and sell them in nearby villages. In addition to the family agricultural business Tea’s husband is a village shepherd. Total average monthly income of the family is 450 Lari (GEL).

Tea requested a loan to expand and repair their cattle-shed, because the existing one is very old. In a new cattle-shed Tea and Jondo will be able to keep more livestock and take good care of them. Also, they want to purchase fertilizers for their vineyard. After fertilization and properly done seasonal agricultural works they hope to get a good harvest. They will sell the harvested products on the local open market. As a result of the above mentioned activities, Tea and her husband will get additional income. With the increased amount of profit the family plans to repair the kitchen. Taking into account the above mentioned, the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to expand and repair their cattle-shed

loans.name: Pedro Eladio

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad; en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear acompañado por pareja por las orillas de un río cercano a su casa y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo “Lomo Saltado” para compartir gratos momentos con su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo.

Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y a sus ganas de salir adelante, Pedro se dedica a la agricultura, él cuenta con un  terreno en el cual cultiva frejoles, donde dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diaria, él se encuentra muy a gusto en su negocio, ya que siempre le ha gustado mucho las labores del campo.

Pedro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abono, fertilizantes y podrá realizar el mantenimiento del cultivo; de esta manera podrá sostener la cosecha de su cultivo e incrementar sus ingresos y en un futuro no muy lejano, espera poder arrendar  terrenos para siembra.
texts.en: Pedro is a 48 years old man, he lives in the city of Camaná with his partner and he has 2 children who are already grown up. In his spare time he likes to go for walks with his partner by the bank of a nearby river and in some occasions he cooks a delicious sauté fillet steak to spend pleasant times with his family. Unfortunately due to lack of financial resources he wasn't able to attend university, but he would have very much liked to do so. Thanks to his entrepreneurial spirit, and his will to get ahead, Pedro works in agriculture; he has a piece of land where he grows beans. He does this for about 12 hours every day. He enjoys his business very much, since he has always liked the countryside activities. Pedro is very thankful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help provided he will be able to buy fertilizers and do maintenance of the crop. In this way he will be able to support the harvest of his crop and increase his income, and in a nearby future, he hopes he will be able to rent lands for sowing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and do crop maintenance

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and only one is currently attending school. She is also looking after her parents. She has been selling tomatoes, onions and green bananas from her home for the last 10 years on a retail basis, working six days a week. She does not have an additional source of income.

She has requested a loan of UShs 800,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more baskets of tomatoes, onions and green bananas to sell. Her challenges include the seasonality of supply and high prices. Her dream is to expand her business and start selling at wholesale. She joined MCDT because she wanted to expand her business. She rents a house without access to either electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expense is rent.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of tomatoes, onions and green bananas.

loans.name: Frankline

texts.en:
Frankline is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya and is married with two children aged ten and three years. He runs his farm with the help of one farmhand, producing maize, bananas and beans that are sold to the local markets.

Frankline has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to install an irrigation system on his farm at a cost of 30,000 KES, and to construct a zero grazing unit at the same cost. He believes this will mitigate the challenge of insufficient rains and improve his farming income, the major portion of which he will channel toward education for the children.

He adds that animal diseases are a great challenge to the farmers. He commends the Juhudi Kilimo loan services.

loans.use: To construct a zero-grazing unit and install an irrigation system.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 45-year-old married man with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. For two years he has been operating a drug shop which he started with his salary savings as a clinical officer. Inadequate capital to purchase stock is the main hardship the client is facing. His dream is to build a permanent residential house and educate his children to higher institutions of learning. His business goal is to expand his business into new markets. The purpose of the loan is to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Malaika

texts.en: Malaika is a thirty-three-year-old single mother of three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children up to the university. Her main business is a pub, which she has been running for the last year. Her main hardship is customers not paying on time; however, she has a vision of diversifying her business to include farming. Malaika needs a loan to buy sodas for resale.

loans.use: to buy sodas for resale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, both of whom attend school. She is not looking after any additional members of the family. She has been running a retail shop for basic items for ten years, for which she pays rent and works six days a week. She earns no additional income.

She has requested a loan of UShs 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more sacks of rice, beans, maize flour and cartons of soap. Her challenges include transportation costs. Her dream is to be able to satisfy all her clients. She was attracted to join MCDT by the fair interest charged on loans. She rents a house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rice, maize flour, beans and soap.

loans.name: Martha Saturnina

texts.es: La Sra. Martha tiene 45 años y es casada con 4 hijos que son de las edades de 26, 23, 20 y 16 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Puerto Ichilo,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Martha utilizara este préstamo para la compra de mercadería, como refrescos, dulces, abarrotes y galletas para surtir su tienda de barrio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la necesidad  de ampliar  y surtir su tienda de barrio, la Sra. Martha enfrenta retos en su negocio que son incrementar su clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Su deseo con el tiempo es tener su propio almacén y así de esta manera generar sus ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Martha, 45, is married and has 4 children aged 26, 23, 20 and 16.  She has a business selling consumer staples in her neighborhood store, which is located in the Puerto Ichilo neighborhood.  This is her second loan with this institution.  Martha will use this loan to buy merchandise, such as: soft drinks, sweets, groceries and cookies to stock her neighborhood store.  The reason she is requesting this loan is to expand and stock up her neighborhood store.  Martha faces challenges in her business, including increasing her customer base.  She will use the profits from this business to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.  What she wants is to eventually have a larger grocery store, so that in this way she could generate more income.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sweets, groceries and other products to stock her store

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 37 years old. She lives in a small village in Baghdati District with her family: son David, who still goes to school, and her father, who is a pensioner.  Irma is busy with her agricultural business. She has a milking cow and produces cheese, which is sold on the local open market. She also has 0.5 hectare of land where she grows maize and a vineyard on a little plot of land. Her father helps her in the agricultural business. During spring and summer seasons, Irma and her father perform seasonal agricultural work to get a good harvest. They sell the harvested product on the local open market. The total average monthly income for the family is 250 Laris.

Irma requested a loan for purchasing fertilizers.  After fertilization and the seasonal agricultural work, she hopes to get a good harvest. She will sell the harvested product on the local open market. As a result of the above mentioned activities, Irma will get additional income. With the increased amount of profit, she plans to repair her bathroom to improve sanitary conditions at home. Taking into account the above mentioned, the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: cultivate her farmland

loans.name: Musahib

texts.en: Musahib is 51 years old.  He is married and has two children. The scope of his business is clothing sale. He has been engaged in this for more than ten years. He plans to expand his business. Musahib applied for a loan in the amount 1550 AZN to buy clothes for selling.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Porn

texts.en:
Porn is 38 years old. He lives with his wife and their child in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. He operates a motorcycle transportation business around the province, earning around USD 3.00 per day to pay for his daily expenses.  During the rainy season Porn, like other villagers, plants and harvest rice and potatoes to provide for his family’s daily sustenance as well as to sell for profit. Besides these two businesses, the main source of the family’s income comes from a hog-raising business that is managed by his wife. This couple tries hard because they want to work out their plans and achieve a quality of life.

Due to the lack of capital to invest in his farming business, Porn would like to take out a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to rent a tractor to till his land and purchase potato plants to grow on his existing farmland. Also, with the remaining funds he will buy a few piglets for his wife’s business. He is very happy to obtain this loan so that he can further improve his businesses and his living standard.

loans.use: to rent a tractor to till land and buy potato plants to grow

loans.name: Peou

texts.en:
Peou, 47, is a married woman and has a single child. She is in the business of making bamboo baskets for extra income, followed by a rice farming business. She has been involved in her basket business for almost 12 years. She sells her finished products to middlemen who come to collect the baskets through the community and continually sells them to a neighboring country, Thailand.  Every rainy season, Peou usually starts growing rice on her family-owned farmland, which is not far away from her house. By the grace of God, Peou always has her husband help manage the rice farming business besides his main business as a construction worker.

Peou now is asking for a loan from HKL in the sums of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorcycle, which she will use for the family’s use as well as for business. This motorcycle will provide her family a comfortable transportation to anywhere they want,  and it will help her family reduce expenses on transportation fees. In the future, Poeu wants to be a successful businesswoman collecting and trading bamboo baskets to the marketplaces herself.

loans.use: purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Eusebio Leopoldo

texts.es:
Eusebio tiene 52 años, vive al lado de su esposa, quien es su mano derecha y es su mayor apoyo en todo lo que él hace, ella lo apoya con los gastos de su hogar ya que en su vivienda ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, ciudd que se caracteriza por tener unas playas hermosas, un clima calido y acogedor, se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, frejoles, entre otros y tambien es muy conocido por uno de sus platillos tipicos el cual es el riquisimo Chupe de Camarones y el cual es el platillo favorito de Eusebio. Cuando dispone de un tiempito libre le gusta mucho pasear junto a  su esposa para distraerse un poco de lo duro de su trabajo. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado mucho tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a Día Eusebio trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y entusiasmo como agricultor, el tiene una pequeña parcela en la cual ha sembrado pallares, él le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día ya que su parcela queda un poco alejada de su vivienda y sobre todo porque siempre tiene que estar al pendiente del crecimiento de su cultivo; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y cuidadoso y sobre todo porque le gusta su labor.

Eusebio está muy agradecido y feliz con la ayuda que le han brindado los funcionarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono para su cultivo y de esta manera poder obtener un mejor crecimiento y una mejor cosecha, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Comprar una motocarga para transportar su cosecha”.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 52 years old and lives with his wife by his side.  She is his right hand and his biggest support in everything he does.  She helps with household expenses since she has a small business selling groceries from home.  Their house is located in Camana, a city characterized by beautiful beaches, a warm and welcoming climate, and agricultural development, especially of rice and beans, among other crops.  The city is also well known for one of its typical dishes, a delicious shrimp chowder, which is Eusebio’s favorite food.  In his free time, Eusebio likes to take walks with his wife to distract himself from his hard work.  Because of his limited economic resources, he was only able to study up to grade five but he would have liked very much to have a university degree.  

Day after day Eusebio works with effort and enthusiasm as a farmer.  He has a small plot where he has planted lima beans.  He spends 10 hours a day working because his plot is far from home and he must always watch the growth of his crop.  He thinks he is doing well in his business because he is responsible and careful, and above all, because he likes his work.

Eusebio is very grateful and happy with the help Kiva has given him because thanks to it, he is able to buy fertilizer for his crops and in this way get better growth and a bigger harvest.  This allows him to keep working to make his biggest dream come true; to buy a motorcar to transport his harvest.

loans.use: buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Eth

texts.en:
Eth is 28 years old.  She is a married woman and a mother of two school-age kids, residing in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is a local farmer, growing rice and potatoes along with her husband for their livelihood. She has more than 10 years of experience in this business. Together, they are able to earn approximately USD 4.00 per day to satisfy their living needs, including daily food and her children’s allowance fees. 

Eth wants to go on developing her farming business, and therefore she has applied for a loan from Kiva through HKL to purchase potato plants for farming purposes. This loan will be sufficient capital for her to invest in her business and make her business more profitable. She believes that through her effort and patience she will be able to obtain a fruitful harvest in the coming season.

loans.use: buy potato plants to grow

loans.name: Srom

texts.en:
Srom is a resident of Baray district where she and her husband cultivate rice crops for food and sale. This couple has two children who are attending a local school. Aside from doing farming, Srom is also involved in a grocery selling business from a convenient shop situated in her house. In her shop, there are many type of products sold such as sweets, biscuits, noodles, soft drinks, cigarettes, home use products and beauty salon products. Srom is a sociable and friendly woman who has good communication with her customers and the people in her neighborhood. That is why she has a lot of frequent customers who are using her products every day.
 
Srom has requested a loan in the sums of KHR 1,000,000 to purchase seeds, chemical fertilizers and pay for operating expenses in growing her dry-season rice crops in this coming season. With the help of this loan, Srom hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of her family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and pay farming operating expenses

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak, 42, is a single mother who engages herself in sewing clothes and raising pigs in her village to generate a living. Because of financial difficulties, Prak has commitment to work tirelessly in order to raise her family of three children, two of whom now are working for a garment factory in Phnom Penh city while the other one is still a student. Prak is not just providing sewing services to local people in her commune but is also a professional seamstress. Presently she lives with her children in Baray district, Kompong Tom.

To improve her business and make a stable living, Prak decided to look for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase fabrics for her sewing business. With the balance of the loan, she will buy a few sacks of feed to fatten her pigs. In the future, she wants to be successful seamstress who owns a big seamstress shop in her community.

loans.use: buy fabrics and pig feed

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Khen is 44 years old and has three children, all of whom are married already. She is married to a local farmer who always helps her in her business of cultivating rice and bean crops.  Besides rice farming, she devotes herself to raising pigs to supplement her husband’s income. Presently, she lives with her family in Baray district.

Khen is now asking for a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to purchase bean seeds for growing in this coming season. She is hoping that she can get the amount of loan she is requesting in order to earn more profit and improve her living condition. In the future, she believes that she will be able to raise her family out of poverty and pursue a quality of life through her sacrifice, effort, and patience.

loans.use: buy bean seeds

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La estética de la señora Luisa se vera beneficiada con nuestra ayuda porque así  renovara la mayoría de su maquinaria. Debido a que con el paso del tiempo y el mucho uso se fueron desgastando y ya no funcionan como al principio; al comprar nuevo equipo sus clientes se irán mas satisfechas con el servicio.
Ella tiene dedicándose a ser estilista desde hace mas de 25 años pero anteriormente trabaja con particulares hasta que se independizo y echo a andar un pequeño salón de belleza en el interior de su casa con el cual le ha ido muy bien y en poco tiempo se hizo de clientela; y siendo su única fuente de ingresos la señora luisa se esmera en hacer un buen trabajo para que sus clientas la recomienden y así poder seguir operando su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Luisa’s beauty salon will benefit from our help because she will be able to renew most of her machines.  They have deteriorated over time and through heavy use.  Her customers will be more satisfied with the service over time.

She has been doing this for more than 25 years but she used to work for someone else before she went out on her own and decided to open her own hair salon.  After a while she established her own customers.  Being that this is her only source of income, Luisa does a good job for her customers who recommend her and in this way she is able to continue operating her small business.

loans.use: to buy machines.

loans.name: Jose Celin

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo para su negocio, pues quiere comprarse un surtido de medicamentos para salir a vender entre ellos piensa adquirir antibióticos, vitaminas, reconstituyente, antihistamínicos, y otros más fármacos medicinales que se ajuste a las necesidades clientes.
El manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le permitió crecer y tener lo necesario para trabajar, hasta el momento se ha mantenido en sus ventas y ha ido cambiando poco a poco las condiciones económicas para su familia.
texts.en: Jose requests a new loan for his business because he wants to buy an assortment of medicine to sell.  Among the medicine he would like to acquire are antibiotics, vitamins, restoratives, antihistamines, and other pharmaceuticals that his customers’ need.  He attests that the previous loan allowed him to grow and have everything he needed to work.  He has been able to maintain sales and little by little has changed his family’s financial situation.

loans.use: buy antibiotics, vitamins, restoratives, and antihistamines.

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es: La Sra. Delicia  tiene 48 años casada con 3 hijos que son de las edades de  5, 9 y 12 años, todos ellos en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la confección y arreglo de variedad de prendas de vestir en su taller de costura  que se encuentran en la localidad de San José,  este préstamo es su octava secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Delicia  va a utilizar este préstamo  para la compra de telas  e hilos por mayor  para su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es ampliar su negocio para generar más utilidades, la Sra. Delicia  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener una infraestructura exclusiva para ampliar el taller de costura y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, la Sra. Delicia es una persona trabajadora su deseo es poder ver a su hijos profesionales.
texts.en: Delicia is 48 years old, married, and has three children who are 5, 9 and 12 years old.  They are all school age.  Delicia's business is making and mending clothes in her sewing workshop which is located in the town of San José.  This loan is her eighth with the institution.  Delicia will use her loan to buy fabric and threads wholesale.  She is requesting this loan as she would like to expand her business and make more profits.  Delicia faces challenges such as obtaining infrastructure solely for the purpose of her business which she would like to expand.  She will use the profits she makes to improve her family's quality of life.  Delicia is a hard-working person and her wish is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads

loans.name: Segundo Uldarico

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 61 años, vive al lado de su esposa, quien es su mano derecha y es su mayor apoyo en todo lo que él hace, ella lo apoya con los gastos de su hogar ya que ella es profesora y enseña en un colegio de su ciudad. Su vivienda se ubica en la linda ciudad de Ocoña, Ocoña es una ciudad en la cual se desarrolla mucho la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, frejoles, maíz, entre otros, también se desarrolla mucho la pesca. Cuando dispone de un tiempito libre le gusta mucho pasear ir a la playa a pasear ya que  le encanta distraerse, asimismo le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Estofado. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos él solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado mucho tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a Día Segundo trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y entusiasmo como agricultor, el tiene una pequeña parcela en la cual ha sembrado frejoles, él le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día ya que su parcela queda un poco alejada de su vivienda y sobre todo porque siempre tiene que estar al pendiente del crecimiento de su cultivo; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y cuidadoso y sobre todo porque le gusta su labor.

Segundo está muy agradecido y feliz con la ayuda que le han brindado los funcionarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono y fertilizantes para evitar que su cultivo se llene de plagas y de esta manera poder obtener un mejor crecimiento y una mejor cosecha, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” mejorar su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Segundo is 61 years old and lives with his wife at his side.  She is his right hand and his biggest support in everything he does.  She helps with the household expenses since she is a teacher at an elementary school in the city.  Their home is located in the pretty city of Ocoña.  Ocoña is a city with a lot of agricultural development, especially of rice, beans, and corn, among other crops.  Also, there is a lot of fishing.  In his free time he likes to walk along the beach and have fun.  He also likes to eat his favorite dish, the delicious Estofado.  Because of limited financial resources, he was only able to study up to the 5th grade, but he would have liked very much to get a university degree.

Day after day Segundo works with effort and enthusiasm as a farmer.  He has a small plot where he has planted beans.  He dedicates 10 hours a day to his business since his plot is far away from home and he must be watchful of the crops.  He believes he is successful in his business because he is responsible and careful and mostly, because he enjoys what he does.

Segundo is very grateful and happy with the help Kiva has offered, because thanks to it, he has been able to buy fertilizers and avoid pests.  In this way, he has been able to improve growth and have a better harvest.  This allows him to keep working toward making his biggest dream a reality: to make home improvements.

loans.use: buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Jonatan

texts.es:
Jonatan tiene 36 años, junto a su pareja, Esther, también de 36 años, viven en la casa que obtuvieron hace 5 años, desde su convivencia.

Él se dedica a cultivar la tierra, tiene sembrado plantas de café. Esta labor la lleva realizando desde hace 8 años y comenta que en cada cosecha le ha ido muy bien, ya que siempre está al pendiente de sus plantas y de esa manera evita que las plagas interrumpan su producción. Para Jonatan, su labor es muy importante, ya que es muy rentable, sobre todo cuando tiene mayor cantidad de producción

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente agradecido por contar con el apoyo de las personas que confían en su labor como agricultor. Asimismo, se siente contento por haber sido aceptado en su banco comunal, promete ser muy responsable. 
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en la extracción de sus granos de café, ya que este mes, es de cosecha para él.
texts.en:
Jonatan is 36 and lives with his partner Esther, also 36, in the house they acquired five years ago, from the time they began living together.

He is a farmer and has planted coffee. He has been doing this work for eight years, and says that it has gone very well in each harvest, as he is always attentive to his plants, and that way avoids having pests interrupt their production. For Jonatan, his work is very important, as it is very profitable, especially when he produces in greater quantity.

This is his first loan with MFP, and he feels grateful to have the support of people who have confidence in his work as a farmer. As well, he feels happy to have been accepted in his communal bank, and promises to be very responsible. 

With this loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, he will hire day laborers to help him pick his coffee beans, as this month is harvest time for him.

loans.use: To hire day laborers for harvesting his coffee beans.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven soltero de 36 años. La casa donde vive es propia, la compró hace 3 años y la construyó a base de material rústico.

Hace 10 años que se dedica al cultivo de café, durante ese tiempo llegó a comprar su propio terreno, tiene dos hectáreas con plantas de café. En el tiempo de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros, quienes extraen de manera rápida los frutos del café, después los lleva a vender a los centros de acopio, donde le remuneran a buen precio por cada kilo de su producto. Con en tiempo desea comprarse una movilidad que le ayude a trasportar sus sacos de café, ya que son muy pesados. Pero su prioridad ahora es realizar el mantenimiento de sus plantas para obtener una buena producción durante estos meses de junio y julio, por ser temporada de cosecha.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se siente contento de seguir recibiendo este apoyo financiero, pues así seguirá con sus planes de progreso. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable,  y se siente orgulloso de tener personas solidarias en su grupo.

Con el dinero de este préstamo comprará abono, el cual esparcirá después de esta cosecha, para seguir produciendo un buen café.
texts.en:
Jorge is a young, single man of 36.  The house where he lives belongs to him, as he bought the land three years ago and built the house with local materials.  

He has been growing coffee for 10 years. During that time he managed to buy his own land, and has two hectares with coffee plants. At harvest time he has the help of day laborers who harvest the coffee berries rapidly. Afterwards, he takes them to the collection centers to sell, where they pay him a good price for each kilo of his crop. 

In time, he wishes to buy himself a vehicle that will help him transport his coffee sacks, as they are very heavy. But his priority now is to carry out maintenance on his plants, in order to obtain good production during these months of June and July, as this is the harvest season.

This is his second loan with MFP, and he feels happy to continue receiving this financial support, as this way he will continue with his plans for getting ahead. In his communal bank, he is a very responsible member, and feels proud to have supportive people in their group.

With the money from this loan, he will buy fertilizer, that he will spread after this harvest so that he can continue producing good coffee.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his coffee plants.

loans.name: Mirian Maribel

texts.es: Mirian tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo, vive en Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Ella es muy trabajadora desde temprano comienza con su actividad de negocio que es la elaboración y venta de tortillas normales y para tacos. Anteriormente trabajo en una tortillería y aprendió esta actividad la que ha desarrollado hace dos años. Este negocio ha crecido mediante la inversión de varios préstamos. Actualmente solicita un préstamo de 8,000.00 lempiras para comprar maíz que es el insumo principal para la elaboración de tortillas, de esta manera su negocio crecerá. Su sueño es que su familia tenga una mejor vida y su negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Mirian  is 32 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Santa Cruz de Yojoa. 

She is a very hard worker. She starts working very early in her business of making and selling plain tortillas and tortillas for tacos. Previously she worked in a tortilla shop and learned this business that she then developed on her own two years ago. The business has grown through investments made with various loans. 

Now she is asking for an 8,000 lempira loan to buy corn which is the main ingredient in tortilla making. This way her business will grow. Her dream is that her family will have a better life and that her business will everyday.

loans.use: to buy supplies like corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Alexa Nohemi

texts.es: Alexa tiene 19 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo y su madre en Olanchito, Yoro. Ella se dedica a su propio negocio donde vende variedad de productos alimenticios como ser: granos básicos, verduras, refrescos, salsas, salsas condimentadas, mayonesa etc. este negocio existe desde hace 10 años era de su madre, y hace dos años lo administra Alexa y está establecido en el mercado local, donde ya tiene su clientela. Ella quiere hacerlo crecer más para sustentar a su familia. Con este préstamo de 10,000.00 Lempiras que solicita va incrementar el inventario y las ventas. Su idea es seguir trabajando y mantener surtido el negocio.
texts.en:
Alexa is 19 years old, married, and lives with her husband and mother in Olanchito, Yoro. 

She makes a living through her own business where she sells a variety of food products like basic grains, vegetables, sodas, sauces, spices, mayonnaise, etc. The business has existed for ten years and it was her mother's. Two years ago Alexa started running the store. It is located in a local market where she already has a customer base. She wants to make it grow more to support her family. 

With this loan for 10,000.00 lempiras that she is requesting, she will increase her inventory and her sales. Her plan is to continue growing and keep her business well stocked.

loans.use: to supply her store with food products like basic grains, sauces, spices, and vegetables.

loans.name: Alma Nuvia

texts.es: Alma de 29 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. ella tiene 3 años de dedicarse al comercio, donde vende zapatos, sandalias, blusas, vestidos, pantalones, sabanas, etc. anteriormente se dedicaba a oficios domésticos y miro la necesidad de obtener otros ingresos y decidió vender mercadería, ahora ya aporta con los gastos del hogar. Esta solicitando su primer préstamo con ODEF de 2,700.00 Lempiras para comprar mercadería y mantener producto en su negocio. Su meta es continuar trabajando muy duro para ver un crecimiento económico en su familia y crecer cada día.
texts.en:
Alma is 29 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. 

For three years she has made a living in sales. She sells shoes, sandals, blouses, dresses, pants, sheets, etc. Previously she made a living as a domestic worker and felt that she needed to have another source of income. She decided to sell merchandise and now she helps out with the household expenses. 

She is requesting her first loan with ODEF for 2,700.00 lempiras to buy merchandise and keep her business stocked. Her goal is to continue working hard to realize financial growth for her family and grow everyday.

loans.use: to supply her business with merchandise like clothing, sandals, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Jessica Pamela

texts.es:
Jessica es una joven muy entusiasta y sobre todo muy trabajadora, tiene 21 años de edad y su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, la ciudad de Camana  se caracteriza por tener unas hermosas playas, se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, también se realiza la pesca artesanal, asimismo se preparan platillos muy ricos pero el plato más conocido es el riquísimo “Chupe de Camarones”.  Cuando Jessica tiene un pequeño tiempo libre le gusta mucho pasear por la playa ya que esta se encuentra cerca de la ciudad, también le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a Día Jessica trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, ella trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y atenta con los clientes y sobre todo ofrece productos de calidad.

Jessica está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como ropa para la temporada de invierno en especial chompas, pantalones, buzos, casacas, entre otros, así de esta manera ella podrá ofrecer más productos para su clientes y poder seguir mejorando cada día y así luchar para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una empresa más grande”.
texts.en:
Jessica is a very enthusiastic and above all very hard-working young woman. She is 21, and her home is located in Camana. The city of Camana is known for having some beautiful beaches. Farming is being developed, especially rice cultivation, and small-scale fishing is also done. As well, very delicious dishes are prepared, but the most well-known is the exquisite “chupe de camarones” (shrimp stew). 

When Jessica has a little free time, she really likes to go for walks on the beach, as this is located near the city. She also likes to eat one of her favorite dishes, which is the very delicious “arroz chaufa” (Chinese-style fried rice). Due to her lack of financial resources she was only able to go as far as fifth grade of secondary school, but would very much have liked to have had a university degree.

Jessica works day by day in her shop selling clothing. She works in her shop around ten hours a day and may serve up to 20 customers per day. She believes that her business is doing well because she is very friendly and attentive to her customers, and especially because she offers quality products.

Jessica is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help she has been provided she will be able to buy more merchandise for her shop, such as clothing for the winter season, especially sweaters, pants, sportswear, jackets and other goods. In this way, she will be able to offer more products to her customers, continue improving each day and strive to be able to make her biggest dream a reality: ”To have a larger company".

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as sweaters, pants, sportswear, jackets, and other goods.

loans.name: Moises Josiel

texts.es:
Moises es un joven de 28 años, hoy en dia labora como oficial de control de bien en la fiscalia, casado y padre de dos hijos pequeños. Su esposa tambien aporta a los gastos teniendo en su casa la venta de leche agria y comida rapida.
El objetivo de Moises es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, el cual ha venido trabajando con sus ahorros por cuenta propia. hoy con la oportunidad del financiamiento en Afodenic, le es posible abanzar mas rapido. El cual hara  un bajarete en la parte frontal de su casa, logrando menorar el calor y comodidad al tener mas espacio. Comprara laminas de zinc, cuartones, clavos para empezar la obra.
texts.en:
Moises is a young man of 28.  At the present time he works as an property inspection official in the public prosecutor's office. He is married and the father of two small children. His wife also contributes to the household expenses by selling sour milk and fast food from their home.

Moises' aim is to improve the infrastructure of his house, which, on his own, he has been doing work on with his savings. Today with the opportunity of a loan from Afodenic, it is possible for him to move forward more quickly. 

He will build an enclosed patio at the front part of his home, managing to lessen the heat and provide more comfort by having more space. He will buy metal sheeting, lumber and nails for starting construction.

loans.use: To buy building materials for constructing an enclosed patio at the front of his house.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
Olga, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, vive con su esposo y tienen tres hijos todos son dependientes de ellos, su negocio lo aprendió por la necesidad económica en el hogar, lo realiza desde hace tres años, una de sus ventajas es que no posee mucha competencia en el sector.
Está solicitando un préstamo con la intención de invertirlo en el negocio y surtir más los productos como lo son las boquitas, galletas, dulces, gaseosas, jugos, pastas, productos de aseo personal, esta compra ayudará a variar mejor el negocio, uno de sus riesgos puede ser la variación en los precios de la canasta básica.
Su objetivo es crear un negocio grande que le generen mejores ganancias y darle a sus hijos la alimentación y educación necesaria para que pueda formarse académicamente.
texts.en:
Olga sells basic household necessities. She lives with her husband and they have three children, all of whom depend on them. She learned her business because of the financial need in the home. She has been carrying it on for three years. One of the advantages she has is not having much competition in the area.

She is requesting a loan with the intent of investing it in the business and restocking goods such as snacks, cookies, sweets, soft drinks, juices, pastas and personal hygiene products. This purchase will help her add variety to her merchandise. One of her risks can be variation in the prices of basic household goods. 

Her aim is to build a large business that will generate better earnings and provide her children with the diet and education they need to develop academically.

loans.use: To buy snacks, cookies, sweets, soft drinks, juices, pastas and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en:
Elisha, a married man, is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya, a town located along a highway that links two Kenyan cities. The town receives a number of visitors besides the local residents. 

Elisha started the clothes business with assistance from family members 10 years ago. He is applying for a loan of 41900 KES to purchase new clothes to sell. Elisha's aspiration is to open another business, and he believes this can be achieved in the short term.

This area also has a lot of coconut trees, which are used to make brooms. Elisha plans to trade in the new business using the extra income obtained from this business. His dream is to own a wholesale shop where he can sell clothes.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nellya

texts.ru:
Нелле 41 год, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей - 11 и 7 лет. Нелля работает мастером – технологом в управлении Водоканалом города Каракол и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи с 2009 года занимается предоставлением услуг дробильни сельхозкультур. Начав этот бизнес с суммы в 35,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний  день у Нелли имеется собственное оборудование  и товарооборот в сумме 60,000 сом. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса составляет около 10,000 сом. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нелля обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку семян сельхозпродукции для дробления.  Доходы от кредита Нелля планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса за счет выкупа помещения, которое она сейчас арендует.
texts.en:
Nellya is 41 years old, married and raising two children, 11 and 7 years of age. Nellya is a master technologist for the Water Canal Management in the town of  Karakol. As an additional source of income for her family, since 2009 she has been providing agricultural milling services, having  launched this business with a starting capital of 35,000 KGS. Thanks to Nellya’s hard work, at present she owns her equipment, and her sales volume is some 60,000 KGS. The monthly revenue from her business is about 10,000 KGS.

In order to develop her business further, Nellya turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 130,000 KGS in order to buy produce seeds for milling. Nellya plans to use the resulting income for a further expansion of her business, eventually buying out the facility she currently rents.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for milling.

loans.name: Neptali Claudio

texts.es:
Neptali es un joven de 21 años de edad, convive junto a su pareja con quien tiene 2 pequeñines de 2 añitos y el segundo de 2 meses de nacido quienes son su más grande regalo de la vida y de Dios y por quienes lucha cada día para darle una vida digna y sobre todo con mucho y amor. Su humilde vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, por su agricultura en especial el cultivo de maíz, algodón, entre otros, asimismo sus pobladores son personas muy amable y acogedoras.
