Neptali trabaja en una granja de pollos, el se levanta muy temprano ya que tiene que estar en su trabajo desde temprano ya que el se encarga de velar por la alimentación, limpieza del lugar donde se crían los pollos, verificar su peso , entre otras labores, a el le gusta mucho su trabajo y es por ello que el cree que le va bien porque es muy responsable y sobre todo hace su trabajo con mucho gusto.

Neptali está muy agradecido y feliz ya que gracias a la ayudas que le han brindado los prestatarios Kiva el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como compra de ventanas ya que su casita no tiene y estamos en temporada de invierno y más aun que tiene a sus hijitos pequeños y podrían enfermarse por el frio, asimismo realizara mejoras en su cocina y levantara una pared para cercar su casa y darle más seguridad, así el podrá ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y con ello ir cumpliendo parte de su más grande sueño:” darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Neptali is a young man of 21 years. He lives together with his partner, with whom he has two little ones; one is just two years old, and the second was born only two months ago. They are life's and God's greatest gift, and for them he will struggle every day to give them a decent life with a lot of love. 

Neptali's humble home is located in the city of Imperial, which is characterized by its hot climate and agriculture - especially the growing of corn and cotton, among other things. Also the people are very friendly and warm. 

Neptali works on a poultry farm. He gets up very early, as he has to be at his job first thing since he's in charge of watching over their feed, cleaning the place where they raise the chickens, and checking their weight, among other tasks. He likes his job very much, and he thinks that's why it's worked out so well for him - because he is responsible and above all does his job with a lot of enthusiasm. 

Neptali is very appreciative and happy that, thanks to help the Kiva lenders have offered him, he will be able to make improvements to his home, like buying windows. Right now his small home does not have windows, and since it's winter and he has small children, they could get sick from the cold. At the same time he will make improvements to his kitchen, and put up a wall to enclose his house and make it more secure. This way he will be able to offer a better quality of life to his family, and complete part of his bigger dream: "to give his family a better quality of life and his children a good education."

loans.use: to buy windows, improve his kitchen, and fence in his house.

loans.name: Edgar Antonio

texts.es:
Edgar de 53 años de edad es originario de Teustepe, de oficio comerciante se dedica a una de las actividades mas comunes de la ciudad de Teustepe como es la siembra de maíz, frijol y trigo. Inicio su actividad agrícola desde hace 30 años debido a que su abuela falleció dejandole como herencia las tierras a su mama, actualmente Edgar es quien se encarga de la  tierras y de darles mantenimiento a los potreros, pero no solo se encarga del cuido del las tierras también siembra maíz, frijol y trigo, ordeña sus vaquitas y cría cerdos. Edgar dice que cuando saca la cosecha la vende en el mismo sector para evitar gasto de transporte y porque es más seguro vender su producto en la misma comunidad.Cuenta con otros ingresos ya que trabaja algunas veces como albañil aunque también vende la leche que producen sus vacas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar parte de los insumos para la huerta y  comprar alambre para reparar las cercas, Edgar dice que este crédito le será de ayuda pues no tendrá que vender unos cerdos de engorde que tiene porque quiere engordarlos aun mas para después venderlos a un mejor precio y también podrá hacerle las reparaciones a las cercas para evitar el paso de las vacas a la huerta. Sus planes futuros son una vez  que saque la cosecha cancelar el crédito y de las ganancias de la venta de los cerdos comprar unas vaquillas para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
53-year-old age Edgar is a native of Teustepe, a merchant, he makes a living of one of the most common activities of the city of Teustepe as it is the sowing of corn, bean and wheat.

Start his farming operation 30 years ago due to the fact that his grandmother died leaving the land as an inheritance to his mom, currently Edgar is who is responsible for the land and maintenance of the pasture, but not only he is responsible for the care of the land is also planting corn, bean and wheat, milks his cows and grows hi pigs.

Edgar said that he sells his crops in the same sector in order to avoid transportation costs and because it is safer. He has other forms of income since it works sometimes as a bricklayer and also sells the milk his cows produce.

He requests the loan to buy some inputs for the garden and to buy wire to repair the fences. Edgar says that this loan will be helpful since he will not have to sell a few pigs that it has because he wants to fatten them more to later sell them at a better price. He will be also able to do the repairs to the fences, which will avoid the cows to step in to the garden.

His future plans are, once he sells the crop, to cancel the loan and with profits from the sale of pigs buy some heifers for better income.

loans.use: to buy some inputs for the garden and to buy wire to repair the fences.

loans.name: Rina Jaqueline

texts.es:
Rina, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, con la intención de invertir más en el negocio comprando se mayor variedad de ropa nueva e invertirá en blusas casuales, ropa de caballero, y ropa interior, con esta mercadería espera poder tener mayor aceptación con su clientela.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo pues le ayudó a mantener el negocio de las ventas y ha podido generar ganancia para ayudar a su familia, el núcleo familiar se mantiene, y cuenta con mucho entusiasmo para seguir trabajando de la misma manera.
texts.en:
Rina, has decided on a new loan, with the intention of investing more in the business buying a greater variety of new clothes, blouses, casual clothing for men, and underwear. With this merchandise she hopes to have greater acceptance with her customers.
 
The results of the previous loan were positive because it helped her to maintain the sales and generate profits, and a result helped her family. The family nucleus is maintained, and she is eager to continue working in the same way.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of new clothes, blouses, casual clothing for men, and underwear.

loans.name: Maria Melany

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un préstamo porque necesita más capital ya que iniciará la nueva siembra de la temporada, comprándose el abono, los herbicidas y las semillas de maíz y frijol, en esta temporada espera tener buenos resultados con una cosecha sana y abundante.
Ella manifiesta que el credito anterior le ayudó para la ejecución de su trabajo, sus ganancias le han servido para poder ayudar a su familia y mantener todo lo necesario en el hogar.
texts.en:
Mary is requesting a loan because she needs more capital to start the new planting season and needs. She needs to buy the fertilizer, herbicides and seeds of corn and beans. In this season, she expects to have good results with a healthy and abundant harvest. 

She notes that the previous loan helped her. The profits have helped her in order to help her family and get everything needed in her home.

loans.use: to buy the fertilizer, herbicides and seeds of corn and beans.

loans.name: Jose Cruz

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poderse mantener trabajando en las zonas agrícolas, él inicia una nueva siembra de maíz y frijol para esto deberá comprarse fertilizantes, semillas de maíz, semilla de frijol, que lo necesario para que él pueda dar inicio a este trabajo, esperando poder obtener una buena cosecha para la alimentación familiar.
El manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior logró mejorar la producción de la cual ha logrado la alimentación y la venta para generar ingresos a su familia, su condición económica se mantiene estable ya que únicamente el cultivo le ayuda para subsistencia.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan so that he can keep farming. He is starting a new planting of corn and beans, and for this he will have to buy himself fertilizers, corn seed and bean seeds. He needs these so that he can begin this work, in hopes of obtaining a good harvest for feeding his family.

He says that with the previous loan he succeeded in improving his production, from which he managed to feed his household, as well as to achieve sales to generate income for his family. His financial circumstances are still stable, as only farming helps him make a living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, corn seeds and bean seeds.

loans.name: Rosa Marleny

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa propia, con su esposo quién es agricultor en terreno agrícola heredado en el caserío Malingas Grand, comunidad ubicada camino a la comunidad de Malingas a unos 20 min del distrito de Tambogrande. Ya cuentan por ahora con un servicio básico como luz eléctrica.

Rosa se dedica a la crianza de ovinos, caprinos y aves de corral como actividad principal ya que cuenta con 15 cabezas de ganado ovino, porcino y aves de corral. La actividad la realizan entre esposos y se apoyan mutuamente. Rosa se dedica a la crianza hace más de 5 años aproximadamente. Con los ingresos que percibe cubre los costos de su familia.

Rosa quiere comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales, con ello podrán crecer más rápido y mejor, además quiere realizar mejoras en el corral de los mismos.  Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1,500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosa is 29 years old. She is married and has no children. She lives in her own home with her husband, who is a farmer on land he inherited in the community of Malingas, about 20 minutes from the district of Tambogrande. Now they have basic services like electricity.

Rosa raises sheep, goats and poultry as a main activity. She has 15 heads of sheep, pigs, and poultry. They do the activity as a couple and mutually support each other. She has been raising animals for more than 5 years, approximately.The activity she does covers her family's expenses.

Rosa wants to buy balanced feed for her animals. With it they will be able to grow more quickly and better. She also wants to make improvements on her naimals' pens. To meet her goal, she has decided to take out a loan of  1,500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals and to make improvements on her pens.

loans.name: Jahayra Elieth

texts.es:
Jahayra de 33 años se acaba de casar, no tiene hijos, es trabajadora de la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace mas de 4 años y actualmente se desempeña como Bibliotecaria. 

Esta solicitando su 7mo credito con el objetivo de acondicionar el cuarto donde habita con su esposo en casa de sus suegros; adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de productos cosmeticos de AVON y ZERMAT a compañeras de trabajo y otra clientela que tiene, por lo que desea utilizar parte del credito para compra de los productos y surtir su pequeño negocio, pues obtiene ingresos adicionales que le permiten pagar sus gastos. 

El mayor sueño de Jahayra es formar su familia y poder brindarle las condiciones basicas de un hogar.
texts.en:
Jahayra is 33 years old. She just got married and has no children. She has worked for the city hall of Juigalpa for more than 4 years. Right now she works as a librarian. 

She is asking for her 7th loan to remodel the room where she lives with her husband in her in-law's house. She also sells AVON and ZERMAT cosmetic products to her co-workers and to other customers she has. She wants to use the loan to buy the products and stock her small business, because she gets income that way and that allows her to pay for her expenses.

Jahayra's biggest dream is to start her family and be able to offer them the basic necessities of a home.

loans.use: To install a roof on her house and to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer de 39 años. Está casada con Simón, de 42 años, y tienen tres hijos. La casa donde viven es propia, la adquirieron hace 20 años, desde que se casaron.

Gloria es muy laboriosa; desde muy temprano se levanta para realizar los deberes de su hogar, después se dirige a sus campos de cultivo donde tiene plantas de café, y para mantener una buena producción debe estar al pendiente de su cuidado, lo cual hace con la ayuda de su esposo. Los sacos de su cosecha los llevan a los centros de acopio de la ciudad, la cual está ubicada a una hora y media desde su comunidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver crecer sus plantas, los frutos rojos de café, ya que son similares a los cerezos; sin embargo les es muy difícil trasladar su cosecha porque son sacos pesados. 
Para el futuro desea comprar una moto carguera y así evitar la mucha fatiga de su esposo al tener que cargar todo él solo.

Este es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por lo que se siente agradecida por el apoyo, que una vez más, le brindan, pues tendrá la oportunidad de cumplir con sus planes de trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable y un ejemplo a seguir. 
Con el dinero de este préstamo comprará plantas de café para incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 39 year old woman. She is married to Simón who is 42 and they have three children. They own the house they live in and acquired it 20 years ago, when they were married. 

Gloria is very hardworking. She gets up very early to do her housework and then goes to her fields where she has her coffee plants. To keep a good production she must care for them, which she does with her husband's help. She takes the sacks from her harvest to the grain stockpiling centers in town, located an hour and a half away from her community. What she likes the most about her work is watching her plants grow, seeing the red fruit, similar to cherries. What is difficult is transporting the harvest because the sacks are heavy. 

This is her 5th loan with MFP. She is grateful for the support that has been offered her once again, because she will have a chance to fulfill her work plans. In her communal bank she is a reponsible member and an example. de trabajo. 

With the money from this loan she will buy coffee plants to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy more coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of pillows and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 

Alberto has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. Aside from that he also sells viand and snacks. He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Alberto has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Alberto hopes to improve his business for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of snacks, soap, canned goods, detergents and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plastics, cans, bottles, and other recyclable materials to sell.

loans.name: Oleveira

texts.es:
Oleveira tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene 04 hijos. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos. La casa está ubicada en el caserío San Pedrillo en el  Distrito de Tambogrande. Cliente vive en la parte  rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.  El Distrito de Tambogrande se caracteriza por ser una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La actividad que desarrolla Oleveira es la crianza de ganado vacuno, el cual le genera leche fresca para su venta diaria y la comercializa en el mercado local. Su esposo es agricultor con parcela propia en la cual tiene sembrado mango y limón en producción.  Ambos trabajan juntos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Oleveira desea comprar alimento balanceado para su ganado, con la finalidad de que crezcan fuertes y poder venderlos a buen precio.  Por ello ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Oleveira is 45 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in a home of her own with her husband and her children.  The house is located in the San Pedrillo settlement in the Tambogrande district.  She lives in the rural part of the district, but it has electricity.  The Tambogrande district is an agricultural zone with regular business done there.  It’s located in the Piura province, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo.


Oleveira raises cattle, which provide her with fresh milk to sell daily in the local marketplace.  Her husband is a farmer with his own parcel where he raises mangos and lemons.  They work together to support the family.


Oleveira wants to buy balanced feed for her livestock so that they will grow strong and she can sell them at a good price.  She has seen fit to request a loan of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa so she can meet her goal.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en:
Cresenciana is a widow with two children. She is 60 years old and lives in Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Cresenciana owns and operates a plot of farmland where she plants bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns 7000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 20000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. 

Cresenciana has been a member of Kiva's partner GDMPC for three years. In the future, Cresenciana hopes for business progress.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Ralph

texts.en: Ralph is from Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old and married. To make a living, Ralph manages a coconut production business. Ralph has been engaged in this business for five years and earns 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Ralph joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 19,100 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Jenny Agustina

texts.es:
Jenny Agustina sigue laborando como docente,quien junto con su esposo, se esfuerzan para lograr una vivienda digna, siendo tambien docente, su hijo labora en una farmacia, y juntos estan logrando el objetivo de hacer su casa de concreto, es atraves de los financiamientos que Afodenic ha otorgado, siendo viable a plazos con cuotas flexibles a su disponibilidad.
Con el credito anterior logro abanzar con las paredes de atrás, ahora continuara la construccion, logrando una casa segura, bonita, y en mejores condiciones de higiene. Comprara materiales en bloque, cemento, hierro, arena, zinc y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Jenny Agustina continues to work as a teacher who, along with her husband, works to build a dignified home.  He is also a teacher.  Her son works in a pharmacy.  Together they were able to build their home out of concrete, with the help of financing from Afodenic, which was flexible in its payments.

They used the money from the previous loan to build the back walls.  Now the construction will continue to create a secure and nice home with better hygienic conditions.  She will buy building materials, such as cement, iron bars, sand, zinc metal sheeting, and begin work.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Lucy Roxana

texts.es:
Lucy  es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el sector Nuevo Mocce, en el distrito de Lambayeque, ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, ella ofrece estos productos en su domicilio ofreciéndoles a sus clientes la venta al crédito como al contado y los ofrece principalmente entre sus vecinos y conocidos. Esta actividad es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia y gracias a ella ayuda a su esposo con el mantenimiento de la economía diaria. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales.
Lucy desea adquirir más mercadería para ampliar su negocio y aumentar su nivel de ventas y ganancias, así también comprar más animales para poder comercializarlos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en: Lucy is a 33-year-old mother living with her husband and three children in the Nuevo Mocce sector, district of Lambayeque, located more than twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  She sells clothing from home, either by cash or credit, mainly to her neighbors and acquaintances.  This business helps her family financially a lot, and helps her husband maintain the daily finances.  Additionally, she raises and sells animals.  Lucy hopes to acquire more merchandise to grow her business and increase her sales and profits, and also be able to buy more animals to sell.  She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1500 nuevos soles to help her reach her goal.

loans.use: buy merchandise like clothes to increase her business and also to help her acquire animals to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients, like fresh meat and vegetables, for making viand (Philippine dishes).

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is from Ozamis City. She is a 44-year-old widow with five children. To make a living, Lilia plants, harvests and sells bananas for a living. Lilia has been in this business for 6 years and earns 5,000 a month from these activities. Lilia is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Lilia has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to let her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an inventory of snacks, soap, shampoo, and beverages

loans.name: Charlen

texts.en: Charlen is a 32-year-old married mom of 3 children. She is living in Capucao, Ozamis City, Philippines, where her wide array of corn production is located. She has been cultivating this land since she was 24 years of age. She normally receives PHP 12,000 a month. In 2007, Charlen joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 19,400 to purchase fertilizers such as manure to increase production. When the crop is sold, she will use the revenue to expand her business area to earn more income and to sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure to increase production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, soap, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of coconut shells for making charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for his motorcycle and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 44 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en el sector Los Peches del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Gladys se dedica  a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que joven. Por un lado cría animales menores, especialmente ovejos, en corrales situados en la parte posterior a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 

Ella desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, asimismo desea arreglar los corrales para que sus animales tengan un mejor ambiente para desarrollarse,  por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 4000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Gladys is 44 years old.  She is single and lives with her family in the Los Peches sector of the Mochumí district, an agricultural zone in the Lambayeque province, located an hour and half from the city of Chiclayo.


Gladys has been working in farming since she was very young.  She raises small livestock, especially sheep, in pens set up behind her home.  She feeds them with grain and natural grasses and sells them, when they reach a good state of development, to businessmen who frequent the zone where she lives.


She wants to acquire more animals and balanced feed in order to expand her business and increase her income.  She also wants to fix up her pens so that her animals will have a better environment to develop in.  She has seen fit to ask for a 4,000 PEN loan through Edpyme Alternativa, to help her reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed.

loans.name: Kakada

texts.en: Kakada is 25 years old and lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is married and blesses with one child. She is a homemaker. Her husband runs a taxi service (Tuk Tuk Taxi). He earns about $5 per day. Because his current Tuk Tuk is old, Kakada is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a new Tuk Tuk for her husband to run the taxi service. This purchase would enable him to attract more customers and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a new Tuk Tuk for her husband to run his taxi service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for the repair shop and pay for electricity for the business

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Joan has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Joan has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Joan hopes to improve her business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of Gasul and Prycegases to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 
Edna has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Edna has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en: Heng is a married father of seven, four of whom are staying with the family and work at the family's plantation. Heng's family live in a rural area of Kampong Cham province and has been farming rice and growing cassava to support their daily life for twenty years. Their business struggles when the price of cassava drops. Heng obtained the first loan from VisionFund in 2010 and he is now leading a loan group to apply for another loan after his first loan was repaid. This previous loan has enabled him to feed his family, providing them with enough food. Heng's group consists of four members and they are all new to VisionFund except him. As the leader, Heng will use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his plantation. Also, he will use a portion of his share of the loan to pay for labor fee. Heng really hopes that this loan will help increase his crop yield and allow him to sell the products when cassava price is high so that he can make more money to better feed his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings and to pay for labor fee

loans.name: Criste

texts.en:
Criste is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has 2 children. 
Criste is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her cousin as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 to buy tools & pay for gasoline for the business.
Criste has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Criste hopes to improve her services to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy tools for her motorcycle and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
Victoriano is a 30-year-old married man with a 1-year-old child. He is a fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. Victoriano also grows seaweed to sell. He works hard to provide for his family's needs and save for his child's future education.

Victoriano is building another fishing boat. He requested this loan to purchase marine plywood, epoxy, nails and other materials. This will help Victoriano bring in more fish to sell. He plans to use any extra income to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase marine plywood, epoxy, nails and other materials to build another fishing boat.

loans.name: Esther Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Esther es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive por una comunidad que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, este sector se encuentra rodeado de montañas las cuales le dan un paisaje pintoresco, nos ofrece varios lugares para salir de la rutina de la ciudad, su tierra es fértil por lo que su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Esther es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija de 4 años de edad, su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en una casa prestada por un familiar.
 
La Señora. Esther debido a que su hija se encuentra pequeña pasa el mayor de su tiempo a su cuidado y se dedica los quehaceres de su hogar, también cría cerdos y cuyes.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando cerdos y alimento para animales.
 
Su meta es tener un taller de costura para ejercer su profesión de costurera ya que estudio esta rama.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the Los Talvos communal bank. She lives in a community that is part of the El Valle parish in the canton of Cuenca. This region is surrounded by mountains which provide a picturesque landscape and offer many places get away from the city and its routines. The land here is fertile, so many people raise animals and work in agriculture, as well as commerce. They still maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

Esther is married. She has a four year-old daughter as a result of her marriage. Her husband is a construction worker. They do not have their own home, so they live in one loaned to them by a relative.

Due to the fact that her daughter is still young, Esther spends most of her time caring for her. In addition to taking care of chores around the house, she raises pigs and guinea pigs.

She has been a member of the communal bank for three years, and she will invest her most recent loan by purchasing pigs and animal feed.

Her goal is to have a sewing shop so she can work as a seamstress. This is the skill she has developed.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is a married woman with five children. She is involved in fishing. Vilma works hard to increase her income and be able to keep up with the needs of her household. She requested a loan to purchase additional fish nets, hooks, and floaters. Vilma hopes to sustain her children's education and elevate her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish nets, hooks, and floaters

loans.name: Evella

texts.en: Evella lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. She supports her family through selling fish. Evella earns 3,000 PHP per month selling fish to her community. She works hard to increase her income and be able to provide for her family's basic needs. She has requested a loan to buy more fish to sell. Evella hopes for her business to grow and for her family to have a more stable living in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Davy

texts.en: Davy is 35 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been selling pickled vegetables for more than two years, earning approximately $6 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $5 per day. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $3 per day. Due to lack of funds, Davy is requesting a loan of $1500 to pay for her daughter’s sewing training fee. This money will help her daughter get a new career and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's sewing traning fee

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en: 50-year-old Artemio lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family. He supports his family through raising hogs and providing carpentry services to his community. Artemio works hard to provide for his family's basic needs. One of his priorities is his children's education. He requested this loan to purchase pigs and feed. Artemio hopes for his income to increase so he can pay for his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed

loans.name: Aubrey Marie

texts.en:
Aubrey Marie owns and manages a dry goods store in Trinidad, Bohol. She is 23 years old and married with two young children. Her husband works as a farmer.

Aubrey Marie earns 8,000 PHP per month selling toys, ladies accessories and home supplies to her community. She does her best to keep her store attractive and keep her customers loyal. She has requested a loan to buy home and school supplies, ladies accessories and more items to sell. Aubrey Marie hopes to elevate her family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy home and school supplies, ladies accessories and more items to sell

loans.name: Sany's Group

texts.en: As parents of two children, Sany and her husband have been planting cassava, which is a common business in her village, to support their family for over ten years. The business earns them around 11,000 Khmer riel per day. Sany obtained the first loan from VisionFund in 2011, and it just ended. Now she is leading a group to request another loan, hoping to get her portion to buy fertilizers for her cassava plantation, spend on land plowing and use the rest of it to pay labor fees. Through this loan, she hopes to generate more income so that she can set aside sufficient capital for her kids' education until they graduate.

loans.use: To pay labor fees, spend on land plowing, and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: Felicidad is a 59-year-old married woman with four children. Her husband works as a farmer. Felicidad supports her family through selling bananas and camote (sweet potato) cue, rice cakes and other delicacies to her community. She earns 3,500 PHP per month selling her products. She has requested a loan to purchase sugar, flour, bananas, sweet potatoes, and other ingredients. She hopes to have increased sales and profitability.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, bananas, sweet potatoes, and other ingredients

loans.name: Sok Chan

texts.en: Sok Chan is 26 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rubber plants for more than seven years, earning approximately $8 per day. Her husband is a policeman who earns about $5 per day. In order to improve her business, Sok Chan is requesting a loan of $900 to purchase more rubber plants to cultivate. This money will help her expand her business and generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house as soon as possible and help her children earn bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber plants to cultivate

loans.name: El Mirador  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Mirador está formado por 13 socias y 1 socio, quienes son todas amigas y conocidas, viven por diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene una geografía accidentada la cual le brinda hermosos paisajes para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su arquitectura le ha permitido que sea nombrada desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad. Su gente es amable, gentil y de un corazón cálido, son trabajadoras que se encuentran en la lucha diaria para mejorar su situación economía y sacar adelante a sus familias, son mujeres emprendedoras que laboran en diferentes actividades públicas o privadas, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Nube, vive por el sector del Don Bosco en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 24 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 4 años de edad. Su esposo es Ingeniero Eléctrico y ejerce su profesión, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Nube se dedica a la artesanía decorativa, ella compra productos de cerámica los cuales los pinta y luego los vende, esta actividad la realiza hace 6 años y labora de lunes a viernes, le gusta trabajar en esta actividad ya que aprendió estudiando y ella es muy hábil.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando cerámicas y pinturas para crecer en su taller.
 
Su meta es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
The El Mirador communal bank is made up by thirteen women and one man. They are all friends and know each other. They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca. Cuenca has a varied geography, which provides beautiful landscapes to enjoy nature. As a result of its architecture, it has been named as a Cultural World Heritage Site since December 1999. The people are friendly, gentle, and warm-hearted. The members of the communal bank are hard-working people who struggle daily to improve their economic situation and to help their families get ahead. They are enterprising people who work in various  activities, both public and private, who still maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

One of the members of the communal bank is Nube, who lives in the Don Bosco region of the city of Cuenca. She is twenty-four years old and married. She has a four year old son as a result of her marriage. Her husband works as an Electric Engineer. They do not have their own house, so they rent.

Nube makes decorative handicrafts. She purchases ceramic products which she paints and then sells. She has been working this way for six years. She works from Monday to Friday. She likes doing this work, since it is what she studied and she is adept at it.

She has been a member of the communal bank for one year, and she will invest her most recent loan by purchasing ceramics and paints to improve her workshop.

Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase ceramics and paints.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en: Bonifacio is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. He is a married man with 11 children. Bonifacio primarily grows rice crops to sell to his community. He works hard to keep his farm productive and his income stable. He requested a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Bonifacio hopes for this loan to help increase his harvest. He hopes for his family to experience a better quality of living.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
This is Charlita, 51. She is a resident of Malibay, Pasay City. She is a widow and a mother to her children, three of whom are working, and two are in high school. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Charlita operates a salon, where people who want to style their hair, nails, etc., come. Her salon is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 4,500 Philippines pesos (Php) in net sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also utilize the loan to buy a hair blower, a foot spa machine, a hydraulic chair and hair treatment medicines. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Charlita hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to travel to different countries. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for salon materials and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en: Ann is 32 years old and married with four children. As villagers of Dambae district, her family has been farming rice and growing cassava to support their daily living for six years. One of the main constraints for her family is not having sufficient food to eat. Ann's group consists of two members. Ann has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles while the other group member has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles. After their previous loans ended, they applied for another loan. Acting as the leader of the group, Ann used her portion to pay labor fees, to spend on land plowing and buy fertilizers. Ann hopes that this loan will allow her to generate more income by selling a good yield of crops and as a result, her family can have enough food and have sufficient money to keep children in school.

loans.use: To pay labor fees, to pay for plowing, and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is 55 years old and married with five children. Conchita has children who are in college.

Conchita is involved in farming. Her husband is a farmer and mainly manages their rice farm. Conchita helps her husband and does backyard gardening. She grows fruits and vegetables to sell to her community. Conchita works hard to support her family, especially her children's education. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Conchita hopes to have increased profits so she can pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with 2 children. She lives in the town of San Miguel, in the province of Bohol, with her family. Her husband works as a driver.

Gina runs a small sari-sari store (convenience store) business in her town. She sells instant coffee, shampoo, soap, sugar, and other items. She earns 4000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month from her store. She hopes to increase her daily income and help provide for her family's basic needs. She has requested a loan to buy canned goods, noodles, toiletries, and more items to sell. This loan will help her attract more customers and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, toiletries, and more items to sell

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Viviana es la tesorera de Banco Mujer Mujeres Triunfadoras, un grupo nuevo que se formó con 8 socias en la comunidad de Cataratas de Talamanca. Está señora tiene 25 año de edad, es casada y es madre de 2 hijos, una niña de 9 años, y un niño de 2 años. La actividad que desarrolla es la cria de pollos, y el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de estos animales así como los alimentos, concentrados y vitaminas necesarias para la cría y engorde, aumentando así su producción y con ello generar más ingresos para su familia.
Este es su primer crédito y tanto ella como sus compañeras de grupo tiene muchos deseos de consolidar sus microempresas y saben que el financiamiento es una ayuda muy importante para lograrlo. 
Viviana es una mujer muy trabajadora que se ha propuesto muchas metas, pero su prioridad a ayudar a su esposo a reparar su pequeña casa, ya que se encuentra en muy malas condiciones, y así poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. 
El resto de las integrantes de este banco van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Viviana is the treasurer for the Banco Mujer Mujeres Triunfadores [Triumphant Women Women’s Bank], a new group with eight members that was formed in the community of Cataratas de Talamanca. Viviana is twenty-five years old. She is married and the mother of two children, a nine year old daughter and a two year old son. She raises chickens, and she will invest her loan by purchasing more chickens, along with the feed, supplements, and vitamins necessary to raise and fatten them. This way she will be able to increase her production and generate more income for her family.
This is her first loan, and she hopes to be able to consolidate her micro-business along with those of her fellow group members. Viviana and her fellow group members know that financing is very important to achieve their goal.
Viviana is a very hard-working woman who has set many goals for herself, but her priority is to help her husband repair their small house, which is currently in poor condition, and be able to provide her children with a better quality of life.
The other members of the communal bank will invest in agricultural activities.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia is a 64-year-old farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Eugenia is happy to have her farm, as it is the source of her family's income. She does her best to keep her crops healthy and her farm productive. She has requested a loan to purchase certified seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Eugenia is hoping that her loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase certified seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sokhan's Group

texts.en: Sokhan is 29 years old and single. He is a villager in the Sa Ang district. Sokhan is both a farmer and fisherman to earn a living. He complements his income by raising pigs. From these businesses, he earns roughly 25,000 KHR per day. Sokhan has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and he is now leading a group of four members to apply for another loan. His past loans have been successfully paid. As a leader, Sokhan will use his portion to buy a wooden fishing boat and feed for his pigs. In addition, he will use the rest of his portion to spend on land preparation for his rice fields. Through the fourth loan from VisionFund, Sokhan hopes to generate income to expand his business and be able to build on some savings for future needs.

loans.use: To buy a wooden fishing boat, to spend on land preparation for his rice field and to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Turdi

texts.en:
Turdi is a man who knows and likes his work. Eight years ago, he began to drive an agricultural machine. He is a hardworking man and always tries to do his work perfectly. That’s why the people who live in his region know and love him. During the past eight years, he acquired a lot of customers. His machine doesn’t use much petrol, and many people prefer his work.

Turdi is married and has 2 children. He loves his family and tries to make them comfortable. This year, he is going to build a bathroom, and for this purpose he has requested a loan of 2000 Tajikistani somonis (TJS).

loans.use: To build a bathroom for his house

loans.name: Phivan

texts.en: Phivan is 29 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than three years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is employed in a local organization. He earns about $6 per day. Her children are still in her care. In order to improve her business, Phivan is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more groceries to resell. By doing so, she would generate more profits to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profits to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Rath

texts.en:
Rath is 47 years old and an industrious mother who is responsible for three children. She is in the business of cultivating rice, bean, maize, and potato crops to generate income for the family. She has managed this business for many years with great help from her husband. She typically earns around 4 U.S. dollars (USD) per day to cover her daily expenses. All of her children are married already and live separately around Kompong Tom province.

Rath would like to grow different kinds of beans, but due to the lack of capital she is looking for a loan of 3,500,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) to purchase seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor costs. She hopes to have a fruitful harvest through this investment and thereby increase her household income. She plans to save some money to buy additional farmland to expand her production.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Muhlaroy

texts.en: Muhraloy is a pensioner, although she does not seem old. She is the leader of the family and a hard-working woman who manages the entire family. Since her husband died 10 years ago she has run the family business and provided for her children. She is engaged in breeding and selling of livestock. Muhlaroy has 28 livestock in the house right now. One year ago she began to build a new house. Her aim is to buy corrugated asbestos board for the new house.

loans.use: To buy corrugated asbestos board

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a 33-year-old married woman with three school age-children. She has a life partner with her husband, who is a local police in a commune, Kompong Chhnang province. She helps her husband earn the income by devoting herself in a rice farming business. Also, she offers beauty salon services from her home. She provides manicures, pedicures and hair removal for her customers. 

Ben has been with HKL for many years, and this will be her fourth loan. She would like to use it for the purchase of fertilizers to put in her land  to encourage growth of her rice, and to pay for labor costs. In the future, she wants to own a beauty salon, so that she will be able to have more customers using her services, and so she can provide this type of service widely to local people.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to put in her land to encourage growth of her rice, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor is 21 years old and is a married woman with an 8-month-old child. Her husband works as a mechanic and farmer.

Miraflor has had a sari-sari store (a convenience store) in San Miguel, Bohol for three years. She earns 3000 PHP per month selling sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, canned goods and toiletries to her community. She works hard to increase her daily sales and save for her child's future education. She requested a loan to buy soft-drinks, canned goods, toiletries and more items to sell. Miraflor hopes to have a successful business and family life in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, canned goods, toiletries and more items to sell.

loans.name: Ramón Segundo

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal La Rosa De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive don Ramón, tiene 57 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos ya todos son mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa.  Su mujer es comerciante.

Nuestro amigo para poder solventar los gastos del hogar desde hace mas de 18 años se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas y bebidas, el tiene un bar en el centro de esta ciudad, su especialidad es la venta de carne asada acompañado de plátano asado y ensalada, nos cuenta que este es un plato que les encanta a sus clientes, trabaja los jueves, viernes, sabados y domingos desde las 9h00  hasta las 21h00. Su esposa le ayuda en su trabajo cuando ella no está ocupada en su negocio pues ella vende ropa de forma ambulante.

Este crédito es para comprar más de sus productos para la venta de la semana como carne, plátano,  bebidas y otros víveres necesarios para preparar los platos. Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la unión del grupo. 

Su meta es tener un local mucho más amplio y adecuado para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Rosa De Guadalupe ["Rose of Guadalupe"] Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Charapato. This community is known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where Ramon, 57, lives. He is in a common-law marriage and has four grown children from his relationship. Two still live at home. His wife is a merchant.

Our friend has been selling fast food and drinks for more than 18 years in order to meet his household expenses. He has a bar in the city center. His specialty is roasted meat accompanied by roasted plantains and salad. He tells us that this is a dish his customers love. He works on Thursdays, Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays from 9:00 AM to 9:00 PM. His wife helps him with his work when she is not busy at her business selling clothing in an ambulatory manner.

This loan is to buy more products for the week's sales, such as meat, plantains, drinks, and other necessary food items to prepare the dishes. Ramón has been in the communal bank for three years and likes the group's unity.

His goal is to have a much larger and more adequate location for offering his customers greater comfort.

loans.use: to buy meat, plantains, drinks, and other food items

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 36 years old and has been selling vegetables and sweet potatoes in Nakuru town for the past ten years. She is married to David and they have four school going children.

This will be her first loan term and she plans to use the loan amount to buy more stocks of vegetables, maize and sweet potatoes for sale in her business, as this will enable her to meet her customers’ demands as well as increase her income.

In the future, Annah hopes to grow her business to make more income, and thereby build a permanent house for her family.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of vegetables and potatoes.

loans.name: Simforiana

texts.en:
53-year-old Simforiana owns and manages a sari-sari store (convenience store) business in San Miguel, in the province of Bohol. She earns 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month selling eggs, snack foods, canned goods, and toiletries. She works hard to increase her income and support her family. Her 3 children, aged 10, 15 and 17, are all attending school. She hopes for her children to be able to finish college and have bright futures.

Simforiana has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, canned goods, and snack foods. She hopes for her business to grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, canned goods, and snack foods

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en: For six years, Shoira has been busy with her own business deal. She knows the business reception very well and that’s why her goods have many customers. Shoira is a very hard-working woman who is always in search of new work. As she lives in the agricultural region, she decided to sell local agricultural products to other regions. Shoira sells onion to Ganchy and Matcha regions. Then she buys potatoes from these regions and sells to people of Spitamen region. Many people are very glad of Shoira’s work because in this way she helps people get vegetables for their meals. Shoira is a lovely wife and mother. She has three beautiful children and tries to raise them in a good way. Her husband helps her in business. Shoira’s aim is to buy goods for the new season. With the profit, she wants to complete business.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther runs a hotel business in Nakuru town and has been in the business for the past sixteen years. She is 62 years old and married to Francis and together they have eleven children.
 
This will be her first loan term with KADET LTD and she plans to use this loan amount of Kenya Shillings 20,000 (KES) to buy more stock of wheat and maize flour, cooking oil, rice and sugar.

In the future, Esther hopes to grow her business and make more income, and thereby improve the living standards of her family. She also intends to build a school and provide education to young children.

loans.use: To buy stock of flour and cooking oil, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac has been selling clothes in Nakuru town for the last three years. The business has been very profitable hence enabling him to provide for his family's needs. He is 65 years old, married to Rose and they have two children aged 16 and 13 years old.

This will be his second loan term, having paid all of his previous loan amount well and in good time. He plans to use this loan amount to buy more stocks of shirts, t-shirts and trousers for resale, and thereby meet the demands of his customers as well as satisfy their needs.

In the future, Isaac hopes to grow his business and open a big boutique, and thereby make more income to educate his children.

loans.use: To add more stock of clothes.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been farming in Nyahururu town for the last 12 years. He plants maize, beans, and potatoes. He is 52 years-old, married to Francisca, and they have eight children.

This will be his third loan term having paid all of his previous loan amounts well and in good time. He plans to use this loan amount to buy fertilizer and potato seeds for planting in his farm during this season.

In the future, David hopes to grow his farming business and make more income; hence, improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Kamenjo

texts.en:
Kamenjo has been a farmer in the town of Olkalau for the past four years. He plants cash crops such as maize, beans, and potatoes; it has been profitable. He is 57 years-old and supports a family of five children.

This will be his first loan term. He plans to use this loan amount of Kenya Shillings 5,000 (KES) to buy fertilizer for use in his farm during this planting season.

In the future, Kamenjo hopes to grow his farming business by planting more cash crops and thereby make more income to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. She is married with four school-aged children. Jocelyn supports her family through raising hogs. She has requested a loan to purchase pig feed and vitamins. This will help keep Jocelyn's pigs healthy and more saleable. Jocelyn will use any extra income to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Maria Tirisa

texts.en:
Maria Tirisa is 36 years old and married woman with four school-aged children. She earns a living selling banana cue, rice cakes and other local delicacies to her community. In addition, her husband is a farmer and she helps him grow rice crops on their land.

Maria Tirisa hopes to help provide for her family's basic needs. She has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar, bananas and farm fertilizers. She hopes to have increased sales and profitability.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, bananas and farm fertilizers

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a livestock farmer and trader in the town of Nakuru. He keeps sheep, goats, and cows. He has been in the livestock trading business for the past six years and it has been very profitable. He is 29 years-old and single.

This will be his first loan term with KADET LTD, and he plans to use the loan amount to construct a shelter for his livestock.

In the future, Patrick hopes to grow his business and open a slaughter house as well as supplying livestock to other markets to make more income.

loans.use: To build a livestock shelter.

loans.name: Tecla

texts.en:
Tecla operates a cosmetics shop in Nakuru and has been in the business for the last three years. She is 38 years-old, married to William, and they have three children aged 15, 13, and five years-old.

This being her first loan term, she plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of cosmetics such as lotions, jelly, hair oil, and perfumes to meet the demands of her customers. With the anticipated profits, she plans to add more stock of cosmetic items for sale in her shop.

In the future, Tecla hopes to grow her business and open a bigger cosmetics shop and a boutique; hence, making more income to be able to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: To add more stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with two children. She lives in Talibon, Bohol with her family. Her husband is a fisherman.

Emma owns and manages a sari-sari store business. She sells toiletries, soft drinks, snack foods and other items in her store. Emma is able to help provide for her family's daily needs with her income. She hopes to increase her income and sustain her children's education. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as toiletries and canned goods. Emma hopes for increased sales and business profitability.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as toiletries and canned goods

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en: Cornelia is from Rizal, Ozamis City. She is a 52-year-old married mom with four children. To make a living, Cornelia plants, harvests and sells vegetables for a living. Cornelia has been in this business for five years and earns 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. Cornelia is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Cornelia has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to let her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Glacy

texts.en: Glacy is a married woman who has 4 children. She is 32 years old, and resides at Macabayao, Jimenez, Philippines. Glacy owns and operates a farmland business, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business two years. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping. Earlier this year, Glacy joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping

loans.name: Luzbe

texts.en: Luzbe is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 5 children with ages between 1 and 9 years. Luzbe is involved in fishing. Her husband is a fisherman and they work together to sustain their family. Luzbe also started a small sari-sari store to help supplement their income. She has requested a loan to purchase fishing materials such as fishing nets, floaters and lead weights. She hopes to be able to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as fishing nets, floaters and lead weights

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 38 years-of-age, married to Peter, and they have three children aged 15, seven, and two years-old. She sells shoes in Nakuru and has been in the business for the last four years.

This will be her first loan and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of shoes to sell. With the anticipated profits, she plans to add more variety of shoes thereby increasing her income.

In the future, Susan hopes to grow her business and open a wholesale shop for shoes as well as open other shoe stalls in other places; hence, making more income and providing for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To add more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 31 years old and a married woman with five children between 2 and 12 years old. Her husband is a fisherman. Jasmin is also involved in fishing. She sells her husband's catch and buys more fish that she sells at a profit. Jasmin works hard to support her husband in providing for their needs. She also makes sure her children are in good health.

Jasmin has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets and gasoline. She hopes for their fishing business to grow and for her children to be able to go to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and gasoline

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.en: Kurbonali is the son of a hard-working man by the name of Arbobgiyaz. Kurbonali learned many skills from his father about collective farming. His father’s experience helps him to be successful in collective farming and business. For more than 10 years, Kurbonali has been busy raising corn, onion and other kinds of vegetables. His wife helps him to sell goods in the market. Working hard together, Kurbonali and his wife try to comfort their four children with modern conveniences. Kurbonali’s aim is to buy mineral resources for the land on which he works and in this way, to develop his business..

loans.use: To buy mineral resources

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en: Virgilia is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with three children aged three, eight and 12 years. Virgilia and her husband work together in cultivating their land and planting rice crops. Virgilia does her best to support her husband and take care of their children. She has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. This will help keep their crops healthy. Virgilia hopes for her family to experience a more stable living condition in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
For over 30 years in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, Loreta, a 57 year-old widow mother of three children, has made a living through the operation of a retail store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns PHP 5,000 a month from these activities.

Recently, Loreta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Galicano

texts.en: Galicano is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Galicano works hard to keep his crops healthy and his farm free of weeds and pests. He needs additional capital to fund his farm. He requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. Galicano hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. He hopes to elevate his family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
This is Luisa; she is 58 years-old, and a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo, a driver, and she is the mother of three children, one in high school, one in elementary level, and one in the college level. By the grace of God, Luisa has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of them all the way through college. For most Filipino parents, like Luisa as she herself has been a college undergraduate, believe that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave their children.

Luisa maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also sells cooking oil for additional income. She earns a minimum of PHP 7,500 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Luisa dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en: Mary Rose is a 23 year-old resident of Dinas, Sinacaban. She provides for her family needs from the little amount of PHP 6,000 she gains monthly from her own gardening business of four years. However, in 2011 she's become a member of GDMPC, and she has applied for a loan at GDMPC micro finance of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Mary Rose wants to make an expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce  banc villageois a été crée depuis le 1/06/2012 .
 
Il regroupe des femmes d'un mème quartier et des quartiers environnants unis par des relations sociales 

communes.

Madame Ramatoulaye est une femme mariée âgée de 44 ans et mère d'un enfant de âgée de 22 ans . 

Elle fait du commerce de détails par la vente d'ustensiles de cuisine .Ramatoulaye dispose d'une bonne 

expérience dans son domaine pour l'avoir pratiqué pendant longtemps.

Son nouveau crédit de 50000 francs lui permettra de se procurer de la marchandise pré citée.

Avec ses bénéfices elle va renforcer son stock ,et participer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
This 'banc villageois' was created on June 1, 2012.  It comprises women from the same district and surrounding districts who are united by common social ties.

Ramatoulaye is a 44-year-old married woman, mother of a 22-year-old child.  She retails kitchen utensils.  Having been involved in this business for a long time, she has a good experience in this field.

Her new loan of 50,000 francs will allow her to buy the above-mentioned goods.  With the profits, she will increase her stock of merchandise and contribute to family expenses.

loans.use: to buy plates and cooking pots.

loans.name: Nelly Esther

texts.es:
Nelly es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman la zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona caracterizada por su clima semi-tropical y por su producción de mango y limón. Pertenece a la región Piura.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace más de cuatro años, ella cría ovejas, cerdos y aves de corral en ambientes acondicionados situados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, los alimenta con granos y pastos naturales y cuando estos han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta en el mercado de la zona.

Nelly desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y ayudar a su esposo a salir adelante. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer emprendedora y con muchas ganas de superación. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño. Nelly agradece de antemano a las personas que le ayudarán a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Nelly, 28, is a mother and lives with her husband and two children in one of the rural communities of the farm district of Tambogrande.  The area is known for its semi-tropical climate and mango and lemon production.  It belongs to the Piura Region.

She raises and sells animals for a living and has been in business for four years.  She attends to her sheep, pigs and chickens in an area behind her home that has been set up for such purpose.  She feeds them grain and natural fodder and once they reach full development she sells them at the market in the area.

Nelly wants to buy more animals and balanced feed to expand her business and earn more income so she can lead a better lifestyle and help her husband get ahead.  Therefore, she has requested a loan in the amount of 700 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to help her meet her goal.

She is an enterprising woman who is very determined to get ahead.  People who know her hold her in high esteem and have a lot of affection for her.  Nelly is grateful to the lenders who help her through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more animals and balanced feed to expand her business.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María Elena tiene 67 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo en uno de los caseríos que conforman la parte rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona conocida por ser productora de frutas como el mango y limón. La zona rural de este distrito de la región Piura se caracteriza también por tener un nivel de vida bastante limitado y por no contar con todos los servicios básicos, en el caso del caserío de María Elena, este solo cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica.

Se dedica desde hace más de diez años a la venta de productos cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes establecido que siempre solicita sus productos con anticipación ya que su negocio opera principalmente por pedido, también cuenta con un stock permanente de productos que le permite responder a la demanda de cierto grupo de clientes que no desean esperar a que llegue su pedido (cada pedido llega hasta un mes después de solicitado).

Por otro lado se dedica también a la crianza de ganado ovino, el cual al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Su esposo es agricultor con parcela propia en la cual tiene sembrado mango y limón en producción. Con estos ingresos ambos sacan adelante la economía de su familia.

María Elena desea adquirir más productos cosméticos para ampliar su stock permanente y poder seguir creciendo como empresaria, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1300 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Elena, 67, is married and lives with her husband in one of the rural communities in the farm district of Tambogrande, an area known for its production of fruits such as mango and lemon.  The rural zone of this district of the Piura Region is also known for its limited lifestyle because it does not have basic utilities.  In María Elena's case, she only has electricity.

For over ten years she has been selling cosmetics by catalogue.  She has a fixed group of customers who always order their products in advance because her business works on an order basis.  She also keeps a permanent stock of products so she can respond to certain clients who do not wish to wait for their order (some orders can take up to a month for delivery).

She also raises sheep, which she sells at the local market.  Her husband is a farmer and grows mangoes and lemons on his own land.  With both of their incomes they are able to support their family.

María Elena wants to buy more cosmetics to increase her permanent stock and continue expanding her business.  Therefore, she has requested a loan in the amount of 1,300 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products and increase her permanent stock.

loans.name: Eldemilia

texts.en:
Eldemilia is from Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Eldemilia is married and has three children. To make a living, she owns and operates a tricycle transport service. She has been in business for five years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2006, Eldemilia joined GDMPC. Eldemilia is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Milagros Del Socorro

texts.es:
Milagros es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en casa de su padre. Su domicilio se ubica en la parte urbana del distrito de Tambogrande. Una comunidad agrícola y comercial ubicada en la región Piura. 

Se dedica desde hace más de seis años a la venta de ropa y accesorios de vestir en su domicilio y también saliendo a recorrer las zonas aledañas al distrito, en su mayoría caseríos de la zona rural. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en el negocio ha llegado a ser bastante conocido y cuenta con una clientela estable. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Ella desea adquirir mercadería propia de invierno para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes durante esta época del año, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de chompas, polos con mangas largas, pantalones y demás productos que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo

Milagros cuenta con bastantes deseos de superación y progreso, es muy conocida en la zona donde reside, las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien responsable y trabajadora. Ella agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyarán a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
